Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	"Thus begins the speech of Albucasim."
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	"Oh, my children, since I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, due to its completion it has come to an end. And because of its explanations and clarifications, it seems to me that I fulfill what I promised to you with this treatise, which deals with surgery by hand."
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	"Since the operation by hand is almost entirely lost in our region and time, to such an extent that the science of it is completely forgotten, and only a few descriptions remain in the books of the Ancients, which are now changed hands and have become obsolete due to their errors and mistakes. Therefore, its intentions are closed and its power weakened."
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	"And it seems to me that I should revive this with an ordering of this treatise according to the way of exposition and clarification and abbreviation; and so that it comes with the forms of cautery tools and other instruments of the work, both for addition to the clarification and preparation of it, which is necessary."
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	"However, the reason why there is no good craftsman with his own hand in our time is because the art of medicine is long, and its practitioner must be well-trained beforehand in the science of anatomy, which includes knowing the joints of the limbs, their shapes, connections, separations, knowledge of bones, nerves, and muscles, their numbers, arrangements, and locations of pulsating veins and quiet ones."
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	"And therefore Hippocrates says that 'in the name but not in deed', meaning that he excelled more in writing than in surgery."
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	"But we have already said at the beginning of this book that anyone who does not know what we have said about anatomy will surely fall into error and cause many deaths. For I have seen too many such cases, where some are formed in this science but depart from it without knowledge or experience."
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	"For I saw a foolish and inexperienced doctor who operated on an abscess in a woman's neck, cutting some arteries of the neck so that much blood flowed out and the woman died immediately."
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	"And I saw another doctor who tried to remove a stone from a man's bladder that had become very enlarged. He came and removed that stone along with a piece of the bladder wall, causing the man to die three days later."
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	"And I had already predicted that this would happen, for I saw that because of the size of the stone and the disposition of the illness, he would certainly die."
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	"And I saw another doctor who was paid by one of our dukes to perform surgery. This doctor approached a blacksmith with a dislocated hip fracture. However, due to his ignorance, he reduced the dislocation improperly using pillows and wedges with great force, not allowing the hip joint any room to breathe."
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	"And he then relocated the limb according to his desires, but when he reduced it, he immediately released it and left it alone for some days. Then he commanded that the bandages be removed, and thus he caused the hip joint and thigh to become inflamed, leading to ruin."
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	"And I was called to him, and I prepared to release the bandages. Then he became calm and free from his pains."
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	"But nevertheless, corruption had already established itself in the limb, so that I could not prevent it. And corruption continued to spread throughout the limb until the patient died."
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	"And I saw another doctor who perforated a cancerous abscess. The wound became ulcerated after some days, and the malignancy of it was greatly magnified in the patient."
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	"This is because cancerous tumors are caused by black bile. Therefore, it is not necessary to cauterize them completely with hot iron, but rather to operate on the limb that suffers from it so that it may be hosted."
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	"And therefore, my sons, it is necessary for you to divide surgery into two parts: one part concerns operations associated with health, and the other involves works in which there is great danger in most dispositions."
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	"And I have already stated this in every place throughout this book where there is mention of operations involving error and danger. Therefore, it is necessary for you to guard against that and leave it alone, so that foolish people may not find an opportunity to speak and bring dishonor upon you."
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	"Therefore, take up your arms with diligence and protection from God, and treat your patients with skillfulness and steadfastness."
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	"And follow the best path through the grace of God, losing your way to health and success. Leave behind difficult diseases that are hard to cure, and put aside your fears, so that you may remain steadfast in your faith and name: for it is more glorious for you, both here on earth and afterwards, with regard to your sanctity."
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	"Just as I have stated in some previous discourses:"
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"Do not treat an illness badly, lest you be named a bad doctor."
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	"And I have already divided this book into three sections according to its contents."
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	"Begin the division of the book, starting with the first part."
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	"The first chapter is concerned with the following topics within the first section: the shape of instruments and the forms of cauterizing irons, and what is necessary for surgery."
La divisio de la segonda partida.	"Division of the second part"
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	"The second chapter is about cautery and perforation, cupping glasses, ligatures, extraction of arrows and similar objects, all ordered according to the forms of instruments."
Divisio de la tersa partida.	"Division of the third part"
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	"The third chapter is about reduction and relocation, and treatment of torsion and similar conditions. This chapter is organized according to the shape of instruments."
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	"On cauterization with fire and medicine, acute remedies, and memorandum on surgery."
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	"With that, begin the discussion of this entire book."
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	"It is necessary for me to speak about the qualities of those things that are useful and harmful in cauterization, and in what condition cautery is prohibited."
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	"Therefore, I say that the discussion about the qualities of what is useful and harmful in cautery is long and detailed, subtle through science, and secretively concealed. Many wise men have spoken at length about this topic, and they disagree with each other on it. It suffices me to mention a little of their discussions, for fear of prolonging."
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	"And therefore I say that cautery generally benefits all conditions universally, whether they are material or immaterial, except for two conditions which are without matter."
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	"In the case of a dry and hot complexion with matter that is out of order; for some say that cautery is beneficial for this, while others say the opposite, that cautery is not suitable for an illness that is due to heat and dryness, since fire has qualities of heat and dryness, and it is inappropriate for an illness of a hot and dry nature with matter that is cauterized and dry to be healed in this way."
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	"And he who says the opposite of that, namely that cautery is beneficial in all hot and dry illnesses that occur in human bodies, argues that when you compare the body of man and its humidity to the complexion of fire, you find the body of man very similar."
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	"I say according to the speech of him, that I have experienced this many times myself."
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	"However, it is not necessary for me to speak further about this, since the matter has already been thoroughly examined and discussed in the chapter on cautery. And having known the diversity of complexions among men, the disposition of illnesses within them, their causes, accidents, and duration of time, [I have covered] everything."
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	"But in other complexions, there is no doubt, and especially in hot and humid illnesses, for all physicians agree about them, and they are not in disagreement about the benefit of cautery in those cases."
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	"And know, my son, that the secret of curing with cautery by fire and its effectiveness lies in cautery with burning medicine. For fire is simple, whose action does not extend beyond the member that is cauterized, and it does not harm any other member adjacent to it except with a slight injury."
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	"But the action of burning medicine extends to those members that are burned by it, and sometimes it causes illness in them that is difficult to cure, and sometimes it even causes death."
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	"But fire, because of its subtlety and its good substance, does not do anything except superfluous. And we know this through experience and the length of service in study with the art concerning the truth of causes; therefore I am excused from lengthy speech. And if it were not that my book is not yet read in this place, I would conceal from you in this pause a secret about fire, namely the quality of its operation on bodies and its expulsive power by which it expels illnesses, demonstrated with philosophical proof, which would clarify your thoughts."
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	"And know, my son, that they disagree about the time when it is convenient to perform cautery, and they consider the best time to be in spring."
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	"And I say that cautery is convenient at all times, because the harm that may occur by chance is submerged in the benefit of what is attracted by the cautery. And especially if the cautery is performed for pains or necessary operations, such as fistulas, which do not tolerate delay because it is feared that greater malice will come, which is worse than a slight injury entering through time."
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	"And do not think about this, my son, for only the common people and foolish physicians estimate that. For those illnesses that are cured by cautery have a remedy at all times, but they postpone it."
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	"And the reason is not as they imagine it to be because cautery is only a substitute for medicine that alters complexion and dries out humidity, which are the cause of pain."
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	"But nevertheless, cautery is superfluous over medicine because of its volatility and virtue of its operation and the greatness of its heat."
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	"But it is possible that the illness returns at some time in the future, depending on the complexion of the patient and the location of the illness, and the virtue of cautery, and what is prepared in the body from the aggregation of its superfluities, and what is received by it in its acquisition through foods and similar causes. But the illness in which cautery is administered should be a subtle one in a member with few superfluities and humidity; thus, cautery for toothache and similar ones does not usually return, but this occurs rarely."
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	"And also the common saying is that cautery is the last resort of medicine, and this saying is truer than they understand it to be because they believe that nothing else profits besides cautery."
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	"But the reason is contrary to this; and the intention that cautery is the last resort of medicine only applies when other methods of cure are tried for certain illnesses, and those medicines do not help, and therefore cautery is administered at the end of the cause, and it profits there."
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	"And from now on understand that cautery is the last resort of medicine, not according to the intention understood by the common people and many foolish physicians."
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	"And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this because of anything other than the equality of gold and the subtlety of its substance."
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	"And they said that the place of cautery does not matter, which is not absolutely true because I have seen and proven that this is only the case in some bodies without others, and cautery with it is good and better than with iron, as they said. But when you perform cautery with fire using gold, it is not declared to you because it depends on the quantity of heat that you want from the roughness of the gold, and because it prepares to receive friction; and if you adjust the ignition, the gold will melt in the fire, and some laminae may fall into the fire due to the occupation of the artisan."
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	"And for that reason, cautery with iron should be performed more gently and more moderately according to the virtue of its operation."
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	"And I have already ordered this chapter on cautery according to chapters, and I have ordered those of the head within the chapters so that later you can find what you want from them."
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	"On cautery for headache caused by coldness and humidity."
Le capitol primier.	"The first chapter."
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	"This cautery helps against humidity and coldness in the serous accident caused by these two causes, such as soda and multitude of fluxes called coriza from the head to the parts of the eyebrows and ears flowing, and multitude of sleep, and toothache and jaw pain, and generally all illnesses that come from coldness, such as paralysis, sodomitisal diseases, and apoplexy, and similar ones in these illnesses."
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	"The form of this cautery is as follows: first, command the patient to be purged with laxative medicine clarifying the head for three or four nights, according to what the virtue of the illness and the age of the patient and his habit require."
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	"And then command him to shave his head with a razor, and then perform the cautery between your hands over a carpeted bench and have him place his hands on his knees."
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	"And then place the edge of your palm just above the bridge of the nose between his eyebrows."
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	"But however, when your little finger reaches the middle location, mark that spot with a tent and then ignite the olive oil cautery of which this is the form:"
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	"And then place that over the spot marked with a tent in such a way that it descends while your hand is gradually constrained and you turn it."
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	"And then lift your hand gently and observe the spot. If you see any amount of bone already exposed on the head, as much as the amount of a grain of barley, then raise your hand again, and if not, turn your hand with that iron, but another one if it has cooled, until you see what I have said to you."
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	"Then take some salt and dissolve it on that spot; let it sit for three days."
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	"And pause over the burn wound at its edges, letting it sit until the fire's skin is destroyed."
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	"And then treat the spot with tetrafarmacon cream until it heals."
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	"And they said that when the plague is opened, the arm should be bandaged more tightly, for it is better and more beneficial in this way."
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	"And some of them said that the vein should be cauterized near to the bone, and the cautery should be held until some part of the bone's head is adhered."
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	"And then scrape off what has adhered to the bone, and then it shall be healed."
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	"And others said that when the cautery reaches the end, it should be pressed onto the bone with great force until the bone cracks, and this is the small form of alphecati."
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	"And they believe that from that spot the vapors of the head expire."
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	"And let the opened plague be held for a long time, and then it shall be healed until it is consolidated."
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	"But I have not seen these two kinds of cauteries in any man, except some because of fear; and leave that, it seems to me, better is with health when it is; for the head is softened by solution of continuity from this same as we have testified in the other members, and more so when the head of the disease is very strong."
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	"And the first kind of cautery is safer and better in my opinion; and that way with that work is healthier."
Capitol segon.	"Chapter Seven:"
Del cauteri del cap.	"Of the cautery for the head."
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	"When severe and prolonged headache occurs in a patient who uses various remedies such as ointments, poultices, bandages, emplasters, powders, cataplasms, liniments, etc., especially if cautery has been applied without improvement, consider whether the patient's head is constitutionally strong. If it is not hot and dry but rather moist and cold, then cauterize again with another cautery."
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	"He cauterized that over the horn of his head with a cautery until the flesh was parted."
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	"Cut the flesh until you see the amount of bone we mentioned and cauterize him with a cautery at the last part of the head where it is called 'the vessel,' which is also where cupping is performed."
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	"And be gentle in this, and do not expose the bone, for this disease causes less pain than all other cauteries of the head."
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	"And this cautery should be applied in its proper place, for it is necessary to use a more subtle cautery on the horns of the head and the occupit than that used on the middle part of the head. This is its form."
Capitol ters.	"Chapter Three."
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	"Of the cauterization of non-ancient migraine."
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	"When severe pain occurs suddenly in the part of the head, or there is persistent pain extending to the ear, evacuate with medicines that cleanse the head and administer the other treatment mentioned earlier for this disease. But if it does not help, cauterization is then performed in two ways: either cauterization with a medicine that causes burning, or with iron."
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	"The cautery with a burning medicine is made as follows: Take a dollop of aloe and scrape it clean, then remove both its ends."
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	"And then carefully cut the location of the pain in the temple with a sharp lancet until you see the bone beneath the flesh, but do not expose it."
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	"Then press over it with a hot compress for a moderate constriction and leave it there for the space of three hours. Then remove it and take away the aloe and let the wound lie open for two or three days, then apply a poultice of bread dough around it until the area becomes dry."
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"And then treat it with an ointment until it is healed."
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	"If you wish, do this with some burning medicines that I have written about in the twelfth treatise on burning medicines."
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	"The cauterization with iron according to this method is as follows:"
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	"And it is called 'closed nails', for its head is shaped like a nail with some curvature, and there is a small prominence in the middle of it."
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	"And apply pressure onto the painful spot, hold your hand steady — so that the heat of the iron is not wasted — and slowly move it back and forth with speed."
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	"And if the amount of heat absorbed by the skin is as much as its magnitude, lift your hand up so that the artery that is left is not burned, so that blood does not flow."
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"And apply cotton soaked in saltwater onto the spot and leave it there for three days; and then apply warm compress with its edge and cure it with ointment until it heals."
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	"And if you wish, cauterize the extremity of the catheter according to cautery and beware of cutting into an artery in this migraine that is not ancient."
Capitol quart.	"Chapter Four."
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	"On the Cautery Treatment of Ancient Migraine."
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	"When you treat migraine with what we have said about the previous cure and what we have said in the divisions of illnesses, but the treatment does not help, then it is necessary to cauterize the catheter within until it becomes white. Because it signifies onto the spot of the pain with a line of length equal to its magnitude or longer; and pause your hand for a moment and strengthen that until you incise the artery and bring about inflammation up to the bone."
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	"However, it is necessary that you guard against the continuity of the mandible, which is moved by mastication; and that the nerve is not burned nor the nerves that move it; and that spasms do not occur."
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	"And if it is about the caution and care of blood flow from the artery that is opened, because in the opening of it there is fear, especially for those who do not know what they are doing and are not studied nor practiced; leave the operation at the beginning."
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	"And I come with remembrance of the regulation of accidental blood flow from the artery according to its manner, in its place in this book."
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	"And if you see this illness that does not abate with this cautery and you see the patient's condition tolerable, then cauterize it in the middle of the head as we have recounted before, and cure the ulcer until it is healed."
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	"And if you wish, administer the cautery that we have said in the chapter on the stricture of artery with cautery having two catheters, and this is better cautery and more confirmative."
Capitol .v.	"Chapter Five."
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	"On the Cauterization of Earaches."
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	"When in the ear there is pain due to friction and it is cured with laxative causes and other cures that have been mentioned in the division, but the pain is not removed, then heat the cautery, which is called puncta, of which this is its shape:"
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	"And when it has been heated, apply it around the entire ear as if a wheel is turned, or in the circuit of each one if the pain is in each one."
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	"And go along with the cautery to the root of the ear little by little until you feel the spot with your tent."
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	"And if you cauterize with ten punctures around the entire ear, and it is sufficient, then cure those spots until they are healed."
Capitol .vi.	"Chapter Six."
De cauterizacio de turtura.	"On Cauterization of Dizziness."
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	"Dizziness that is cured with cautery is only of those species which come from phlegm, according to what we have said in the divisions of illnesses."
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	"Avoid cauterization for the species that occurs due to dryness or spasms of nerves."
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	"When treating that type of tumor with herbs and caper spurge and garlic, if your treatment does not help, then you should cauterize the patient with three cauteries: one at the root of the ear, the second a little below their temple, and the third at the junction of two lips."
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	"Then pause your cautery in the contrary direction to where the wound is, for softening only occurs on the part that appears sound."
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	"And the manner of cauterization is such that you cauterize it with the cautery on the right side of the tip of the ear, then slightly above the horn of the head, and on the temple, whose length should be equal to the length of your finger, and pause your hand with the cautery until it has consumed about half the thickness of a rope."
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	"And this is the form of the cautery, which is specific to barbers, and its shape is described before us."
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	"But it is still more subtle than what you see here; and it would be better to cut away excess roughness in place of unnecessary delicacy."
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	"And apply the cure with that which is described in its proper place until it is healed."
Capitol .vii.	"Chapter VII."
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	"On cauterizing ancient stroke (apoplexy)."
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is ancient and the cure for it is what we have said, and the patient does not confirm your medicine but has no fever, then cauterize him with four cauteries: on all the horns of his head; and one cautery in the middle of the head, as we have said; and another cautery on the cheek.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the manner of cauterizing is done according to what has been said above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	Now cauterize over the mouth of the stomach, and it should be more recent; then it shall be cured with what you will prescribe.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On cauterizing for oblivion caused by a tumor.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	"Give the patient at the beginning large jars and purifying pills."
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	"And then cover the entire head of the sick person, pausing on its crown, place the plaster described in the treatise on plasters."
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	"And pause for some time, because this is a manner of cautery."
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	"And do this according to that methodical order which I have already mentioned."
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	"If this does not heal well, then perform three cauteries on the last part of his head, which should be descending from the most superior part of the head toward the most inferior part of the neck."
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	"And pause between each cautery for the thickness of a finger, and then immediately dress the cautery with what has been produced."
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	"But if you see that the patient tolerates this badly, then perform the cautery in the middle of the head; but if you want greater cautery, then cauterize him on both temples."
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	"And dress it immediately until it is healed; and let the cauteries be round according to the shape mentioned before."
Capitol .ix.	"Chapter IX."
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	"Burning of parasites and softening of the entire body."
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	"After preparing the head with erasures and water as we have said; then remove the patient's hat, and burn that area with a cautery in the middle of the head, and apply cauteries to all the corners of the head, and apply cauteries to the back part of it, and apply three cauteries to the cervical vertebrae."
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	"And if it is necessary to soften the body too much in illnesses that are poorly tolerated and the illness is severe, then apply four cauteries on the lumbar vertebrae, and also apply a cautery on the sacrum between the buttocks, lifting up the thigh."
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	"And also cure that area with olive oil, after it has healed, using a cautery."
Capitol .x.	Chapter .x.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	"On cauterization for epilepsy."
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	"No one is cauterized except in the case of epilepsy caused by phlegm."
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	"And therefore at the beginning of the illness, prepare the brain with erasures and the other treatment which we have said in the division when the illness is great and poorly tolerated except for medications."
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	"And if the child cannot tolerate medications, then administer gargarisms and mastigators to soften the brain, for several days before, with beneficial diet."
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	"And also shave the head of the patient, and then cauterize it with one cautery in the middle of the head according to the manner previously mentioned, and another cautery on the occiput of it, and cauterize each corner of the head."
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	"And if the illness is severe and poorly tolerated, then cauterize it with cauteries as mentioned earlier, having paralysis and softening of the body on the cervical vertebrae and lumbar vertebrae."
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	"And let it be cauterized with olive oil according to what has been said previously."
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	"But if the illness is in a child, then pause and use subtle cauteries in this manner:"
Capitol .xi.	Chapter .xi.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	"On cauterization for melancholy."
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	"When the causes of melancholy are corrupt humors and thick phlegm, then cauterize it with cauteries as mentioned earlier, having paralysis."
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	"And if the cause of melancholy is declining towards it due to excess, and the body of the patient is humid, then let him drink that which cleanses the brain according to what has been mentioned earlier in this division."
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	"And also shave the head of the patient, and then make a small poultice well-made of it on the circle, and then place it in the middle of the head."
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	"And let the patient be seated comfortably, and let him be held by someone from every part."
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	"And also apply a liniment, and then it is worthy of being rubbed with lamb's fat."
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	"And heat it on the fire for gentle warmth by measure, which the patient should suffer when it is applied to him."
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	"And then place it in the middle of the head of the patient within the circle, and leave it until it has cooled down."
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	"And do this with the patient once a week until he is healed, with the other regimen of him being well; or if you wish, cauterize it making small punctures according to his strength, but keep your hand with such an arranged cautery: this is a special cautery which moistens the brain with equality."
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	"And then apply that poultice wrapped in a bandage or a piece of wool."
Capitol .xii.	Chapter .xii
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	"On cauterization for descending water in the eye."
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	"When it has been declared to you that the beginning of water in the eye has appeared through the signs which I have mentioned earlier in this division, then begin and give the patient to drink what cleanses his head, and protect him from all humidity."
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	"And make him take a bath with hot water for several days."
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	"And then command him to shave his head, and cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head; and also cauterize it with two cauteries on both temples if it is the beginning of descent of water in both eyes, or on one temple if it is the beginning of water in one eye."
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	"Incise with a cautery all the veins and arteries which are close to the neck; and let the cauteries be in that length on the level of the temples."
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	"And guard yourself from fluxes of blood when it is cauterized; and if you see any fluxes of blood, stop them with some medicine, which is at your disposal."
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	"And I will come with wisdom in the extraction of arteries and in the ablation of those and caution concerning fluxes of blood."
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	"And sometimes it is cauterized on the back of the neck near two bones with two cauteries producing smoke."
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter .xiii
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	"On cauterization for old tears."
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	"When tears of the eyes are old and abundant, and it is found that this is due to thick phlegmatic excess in the veins and arteries which are manifested on the surface of the head, then cauterize it with a cautery as mentioned in the chapter on the beginning of water rising in the eyes, and with a cautery in the middle of the head and with two cauteries on the back of the neck near the temples, and with two cauteries on the back of the neck near two bones."
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	"And if you need addition, then cauterize it also on all sides of the cheekbone above the end of the eyebrow with a small cautery."
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter .xiiii.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	"Regarding cautery for bad breath."
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	"When you treat that person with what we have said in the division and your treatment does not help, then prepare this ointment and give it to the patient to drink for three nights; afterwards, shave their head, and cauterize the area with a hot iron, using olive oil."
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	"And then cauterize that spot with a clove-hot iron, placing two cauteries above the eyebrows on each side of the hairline."
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	"And be careful not to burn yourself with the hot cautery."
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	"This is how you apply the clove-hot cautery:"
Capitol .xv.	"Chapter XV."
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	"Regarding cauterization for drooping eyelids."
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	"If the eyelid is drooping due to illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with an iron using this lunar cautery; and this is how it should be done:"
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	"And if you wish to do so, cauterize that spot above both eyebrows a little with two cauteries in each part, and they should be elongated from the temples."
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	"And let the length of each cautery be according to the amount of eyebrow."
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	"Don't press too hard with your hand on the cautery, but rather according to how much the third part of the eyelid should be burned."
Capitol .xvi.	"Chapter XVI"
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	"Regarding cauterization of the eyelid when the hairs are turned inward and piercing the eye:"
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	"When the hairs of the eyelid are turned inward so as to pierce the eye, cauterize them either with fire or with medicine that burns."
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	"If you cauterize with fire, first tell the patient to pull out his hairs like those who pluck them for depilation, until they are elongated and hardened; and if it pierces there, then stretch the eyelids with a bandage so that it is not harmed while the hairs are growing."
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	"Therefore, when they are grown and hardened, then have the patient hold his head steady in the air, and press the eyelid of the eye with a probe, shaped like a mortar leaf, and let the beginning of the probe be close to the hairs."
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	"And then pause on that spot by immersing it in powdered alum or mucilage of pimpernel on the eye."
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	"And then ignite the cautery, whose shape is like this:"
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	"And then cauterize along the figure which is marked here, bit by bit, with several glances, until its surface burns completely, just like a myrtle leaf."
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	"The sign of the good deed is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracted and its hairs raised above the puncture of the eye."
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	"Then raise your hand and leave him for three days, and then pause on that spot with a bandage until the scar is healed."
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"And then treat it with ointment until it heals."
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	"But if the hairs return again for some cause and the eyelid becomes softened, then do the cautery once more on that spot just as you had done initially."
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	"But if the hairs are still on the eyelid, then cauterize them until they are raised to their natural place and hardened, so that they do not pierce the eye."
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	"But if you use a cautery with burning medicine, then order the patient to pull out his hairs until they are elongated and hardened, and then make a paper from cloth in the shape of a myrtle leaf."
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	"And then take known soap and live coal ashes an ounce each, or whatever you have, and then mix those ashes well, and do this with haste so that it does not get cold; and then spread this on the paper made like a myrtle leaf shape, and place this over one eye or both eyes; and place some of that on the spot of the eye immersed in powdered alum, and let the patient's head be held upright."
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	"And then place your finger on the medicine and press it gently without harming him until the patient feels the biting of the medicine, for biting is like that of fire."
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	"And then when he perceives that it feels like biting, then remove the medicine and wipe it with your finger; and then when the biting stops, then remove the medicine and wash the eye with water; and then consider if sometimes the eyelid is already raised just like it was washed from constriction with fire or incision, for then it is good; and if not, then return to that medicine on the spot where it has not been applied before and do not relent until your operation is hardened and the eye is contracted."
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	"And then place a bandage on that spot until the scar of adhesion is healed, and then treat it with ointment or some other thing until it heals."
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	"And it is necessary that you, during your operation, guard with vigilant diligence that no dirt from the medicine falls into the eye, and if the eyelid becomes softened after several days and some hairs again pierce the eye for some cause, then repeat your medication on that spot where the eyelid has become softened, and exactly as you did at the beginning, and then heal it."
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	"And this is the shape of a myrtle leaf:"
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	"And know that human eyes are diverse according to their magnitude and smallness, and therefore your contraction should be made accordingly."
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	"And do not close the path of rectitude towards anyone who studies in this art."
Capitol .xvii.	"Chapter XVII."
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	"On the cautery of a fistula that is in the tear duct of the eye."
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula as we have mentioned in the divisions of illnesses and your treatment is ineffective, then you should cauterize it in this manner: command the patient to place their head on their own seat, and hold their head steady with some assistant's hands so that it is neither moved nor agitated by their head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then pause a piece of gauze or cotton wool soaked in hot wax or pitch on the wound, covering it completely.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And now ignite the cautery which is in this form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is cone-shaped, like the shape of a reed or vulture's feather, at one extremity where the cautery is made
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, it may be penetrating into the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want, it can come out like this:
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But that which is cone-shaped is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	"Then press on the abscess if it is open, and draw out its liquid and dry it."
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	"And if it's not open, then lance that area and extract the pus from it."
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	"And then apply the cauterizer that has been well ignited, and press it on that area with a little force at the beginning of the nose, so that you do not burn your hand or disturb the patient, and then pause the cauterizer in the wrinkles of the skin and char it."
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	"If at the beginning of your cauterization it enters into the bone, that is good; and if not, then repeat the cauterization once or twice if necessary; and leave that area thus for three days, and then apply to that wound with a border and surroundings with a drying ointment until it heals."
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	"But if eleven days have passed and it is not healed, then apply to it a sharp corrosive medicine until the bone is exposed and scrape it according to what is suitable in its chapter."
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	"And another method of cauterizing a fistula is that which was first described as follows: enter into the location of the fistula and burn it with this thin camphor wax of the shape of the fistula. And then put in there the amount of one grain of melted lead; and hold your hand on it with the camphor wax with good retention, so that the patient is not harmed because the melted lead does not reach the skin of that area; and cover that burned wound with albumen of egg white or water, for the lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it by wonderful healing."
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	"And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cauterization and treatment, that is good; but if not, then it is necessary to administer a suppository of the nose and reduce the fistula into the course of the nose according to what will come in its proper place."
Capitol .xviii.	"Chapter XVIII."
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	"Of the cauterization of the anal fissure."
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	"Fissures often occur in the lips, and most frequently in the lips of infants."
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	"Therefore when you treat those fissures with what we have said in the divisions and it does not help your treatment, then perform a small cautery incision according to this form that is shown here:"
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	"And let its concavity be according to the thinness of the scalpel."
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	"Then place that little incision carefully in those fissures until the cautery reaches the bottom of the fissure."
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	"Then also heal it using wax, once it has been healed."
Capitol .xix.	Here's sentence 19 to translate from Occitan:
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Cauterization of a fistula in the mouth
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When an apostema forms on the uvula or palate or tonsils and it bursts and becomes infected, and then breaks open and a fistula is formed, you should clean it out and not neglect its treatment. Otherwise, if necessary, you must cauterize according to the amount of pus received in the fistula, and put the heated iron into the opening of the fistula, and place your hand so that the hot iron reaches the front of it, and repeat this once or twice; then cure it with what we have said about treatment until it heals.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And if the bone is resected and healed, then it is good. But if not, it is necessary to expose the site and remove the decayed bone according to what is described in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of cauterization of teeth and softening of gum abscesses.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the abscesses are softened by moisture and teeth are affected, if you attempt to treat them with medicines but do not succeed, then place the patient's head on the pillow, immediately ignite the cautery whose shape is depicted here. Thus, you should place the pincers on the tooth and insert the ignited cautery swiftly, while keeping your hand slightly away so that the patient feels the heat of the fire reaching the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then quickly withdraw your hand, and repeat the cauterization several times according to what you desire.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then have the patient rinse their mouth with saltwater and hold it there for an hour, then spit it out. For the affected tooth will be solidified, the softened gum strengthened, and the corrupted moisture dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the cauterization of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is caused by coldness or worms in the tooth, or if medical treatment does not succeed, then cauterize it in this way:
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	"You should take a border of cowhide and stretch it tightly over the iron head of the cautery; then take cotton and wrap it around the tip of the cautery. Then quickly plunge the cautery bordered with cowhide into boiling water, and immediately apply it to the painful tooth before it cools."
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	"And repeat this several times until the heat of the fire reaches the root of the teeth."
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	"If you wish, dip wool or cotton in the cowhide border mentioned above and place it on the painful tooth, then place the red-hot iron on top of it until the iron reaches the surface of the concavity of the tooth."
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	"But be careful with fire cautery: wait until the iron or coal is red-hot and glowing brightly in its center, without scorching the mouth of the patient."
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	"And then ignite the cautery according to its shape, and place it on the tooth with your hand until it cools down; do this several times until the pain disappears completely, either that day or the next."
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	"And it is necessary that after this cautery, the patient fills their mouth with good border and holds it for one hour, then spits it out. This is the form of the cautery."
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	"And cauterize according to what you wish or can, using extreme care."
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	"And this is the form of the cannula:"
Capitol .xxii.	"Chapter XXII."
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	"On the cautery of external prolapses."
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	"When prolapses are made of mucus and humors, rubbed on but not digested by medications, and you wish to promote digestion of them slightly, then ignite the cautery with this shape: it has two hollow extremities through which the smoke should rise from one end of the cautery to the other. Place the hot cautery on the prolapse once or twice until it reaches its surface."
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.
