Capitol .xxiii.	"Chapter XXIII."
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	"On the cautery of sorethroat and constriction of windpipe."
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	"When humidity comes upon the channel of the lung, especially when it is due to coldness of temperament, then the patient should first be evacuated with laxative medicines. Then cauterize him on the back of his throat in the depressed place."
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	"But take care not to reach the gag reflex with the cautery nor burn much of the wall of the esophagus."

E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	"The cautery should be applied thus for two or three times, following the manner described above."
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	"And then dress him as stated previously until he is healed."
Capitol .xxiiii.	"Chapter XXIV."
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	"On the cautery of lung disease and coughing."
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	"When coughing and lung disease are due to rubbed-on humidity, the patient has no fever or spitting of blood, and it is an old illness, then cauterize him with two cauteries on the furcula in the depressed places at both sides and below; and with another cautery in the middle of his chest between his two nipples. Apply the cauteries thus for two or three times following the manner described above."
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	"And if you wish, your cautery should be performed puncturing with the cautery called 'punctum,' the shape of which is given in the puncture for earache."
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	"Make punctures at those points; and then dress him with what has been stated previously until he is healed."
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	"And since the cautery has three branches for this operation, you can perform three cauteries following this shape in one session:"
Capitol .xxv.	"Chapter XXV."
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	"On the cautery of tittillio (i.e., twitching or spasms) which is called 'the head of the helper'."
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	"When the 'head of the helper' (i.e., the atlas vertebra) is dislocated due to lubricating humidity and does not return to its proper position at the usual time, but rather moves slightly causing it to dislocate as we have witnessed, then first reduce the dislocation. Then place the patient on his back or side. Then elevate the neck which is located within the citillo (i.e., the atlas vertebra) using your left hand so that the junction is reduced."
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And then apply the cautery, which has two heads. This is its shape:"
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	"And then cauterize the neck so that it penetrates from one side to the other. Now follows the figure for cautery with four cauteries."
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And perform this subtly according to the quantity of bandages. This is its shape:"
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	"Some times it may be appropriate thus, and there are eight cauteries in all."
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	"And then pause on the cautery for a short while with salt and water. Then have the patient lie quietly until he is comforted. Do not move him for any time."
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	"And if the dislocation is above and it happens thus, then cauterize on the muscle with a cautery applied thus or with multiple puncturing cauteries, for the junction is strengthened and the humidity is broken up and the patient is healed."
Capitol .xxvi.	"Chapter XXVI."
De cauterizacio del stomac.	"On the cautery of the stomach."
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	"When there is heat and much humidity in the stomach that it extracts from its temperament and produces many flatulent rumbles, if you continue with these remedies and do not help him, then place the patient on his back with his arms and legs extended. Then cauterize him thus: apply one cautery to his left side of his chest for the length of a finger using a cautery applied thus; and apply two cauteries below both sides of this cautery so that it forms a triangular figure. Lengthen those which are not well-adjusted lest they cause blisters."
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	"And the depth of the cauteries should be the thickness of two thumbs of the width of the neck."
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	"And this is the shape of the cautery according to this form. And if you wish, cauterize with a large cautery in the middle of the stomach thus: and this will be one cautery shaped like a circle thus:"
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	"And the stomach should be punctured thus for those who are frightened by this cautery. And if you see on the stomach a puncture as large as you wish with a bandage, then cauterize it with a cautery at that point. Then dress him with the dressing stated previously until he is healed."
Capitol .xxvii.	"Chapter XXVII."
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	"On the cautery of a hot liver."
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	"When pain is felt in the liver due to coldness or humidity or excessive windiness so that it deviates from its normal temperament by superfluous exit, and if the patient is not helped by what has been said here, then place him on his back with his head supported. Then apply three cauteries of this form and size thus over the liver on its left side near the hypochondria where a man lies on his right side."
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	"And let the space between each cautery be according to the thickness of a finger; and let the cauteries be according to the length of the right side of the chest."
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	"Do not press too much with the cautery."
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	"And if the amount of water that adheres is equal to half a finger's width in thickness, do not adjust it further. And if the patient stands on his feet; and if he does not stand, then let him lie down, having already extended his arms and legs. Then raise his elbows."
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	"And this is the form of the cautery:"
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	"It is possible for you to cauterize these cauteries with a surgical cautery, if you possess subtlety and prudence in the art."
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	"And beware that you do not proceed in the cauterization, and ensure that the specific heat of the entire chain is maintained so that everything within it becomes heated, because here the chain is thin; and know this."
Capitol .xxviii.	"Chapter XXVIII"
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	"Of the perforation of an abscess of the liver with a cautery."
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	"When an abscess or tumor forms in the liver and you wish to know whether that abscess is in the flesh of the liver or in its membrane, then if it is in the flesh of the liver, the illness becomes serious and painful, without sharpness."
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	"And if it is in the membrane of the liver, then the pain is sharp and great, and often the physicians become tired of treating it."
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	"Therefore it is necessary that the illness be turned towards its back; and approach the location of the abscess with a finger; and then heat the cautery like wool, the shape of which has been previously described in another page."
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	"And cauterize with that cautery until the entire chain is consumed, until it reaches the cyphack, until in ashes it becomes clean."
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	"And then treat it by the treatment of other abscesses until it is healed."
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	"And it is necessary that this form of cautery be used only by one who has prolonged his studies in the art of medicine and knows many illnesses; but even he should not attempt this operation without experience several times, but rather let those others do it, which is better."
Capitol .xxix.	"Chapter Twenty-Nine."
De cauterizacio de plauresi.	"On cauterizing pleasure."
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	"According to ancient methods of cautery for pleasure caused by the hilum of the testicle, follow this manner: Take a long, dry stick from the Aristolochia plant, pointed at one end, as thick as your finger."
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	"And then immerse that stick in oil and heat it in the fire, and cauterize with it at the spot which is between the continuation of the collarbone and the neck; and with two small cauteries guide them, one a little inclined towards the side where the beard is, and with two cauteries inclining slightly between the fifth rib and the armpit, inclined somewhat toward the back parts; and with another cautery in the middle of the thigh; and with another on the stomach, and with three cauteries on the back parts; and with one cautery between the two buttocks, and with two cauteries on both sides of the thigh."
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	"And you do not need to hold your hand with the cautery, but it should be done quickly and surely."
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	"And it was said by some ancients that men use cauteries made of iron like a ray, and heat them in the place between the ribs until they reach the aposteme and cleanly burn it, as we have said concerning the aposteme on the liver."
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	"But in this case of cautery there is no fear of death, for such an occurrence happens rarely at the location called 'fistula', which does not heal."
Capitol .xxx.	"Chapter Thirty"
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	"On cauterizing the melons (testicles)"
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	"When you treat the disease of the testicles with what we have said about cure in division and your treatment does not improve, then cauterize it in this manner: According to three methods, all of which are correct. One method is to make three or four cauteries along the length of the testicle according to the figure of the liver cauteries, the shape of which has been previously described."
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	"And let each cautery be as thick as a finger or a little more, and the manner of cautery should be done in the same way we have described for liver cauteries."
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	"And do not hold your hand with the cautery; let the disease be evident on its own two sides."
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	"And another method of cauterizing is: heat the cautery having two vents, the cause of which we have described in the chapter on dislocation of muscles, and elevate the cord which is towards the left testicle where the disease lies."
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	"And let your elevation be such that you raise the cord according to the length of the body, so that cauteries can be made along the width of the body."
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	"And bring the two vents close together, lighted with a hot flame, until they penetrate the cord on the other side."
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	"Then remove the cautery; and thus four cauteries are made."
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	"And if you wish, cauterize with a cautery having three vents."
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	"Then treat the cautery as soon as it has ceased to discharge blood for several days, because it is more effective than the other causes mentioned in treatment."
Capitol .xxxi.	"Chapter Thirty-One"
De cauterizacio de ydropici.	"On cauterizing hydrocele."
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	"Not to burn in hydrocele but rather on its wall properly."
Quan tu curas le ydropic am las manieyras de curacio las quals havem ditas en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que aquel cauterizes am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic e am un cauteri sobre l’estomac, e am autre cauteri sobre le fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa, e am dos cauteris entre les spondils del dos, e un cauteri en lo dreyt del pietz, e am autre cauteri sobre l’estomac.	"When you treat hydrocele with the methods of treatment that we have mentioned in this section and do not succeed, then it is necessary to cauterize with four cauteries around the navel and one on the stomach, and another on the liver, and another on the spleen, and two cauteries between the spinal vertebrae, and one on the right side of the foot, and another on the stomach."
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	"And the quantity of the depth of the cautery should be proportional to the thickness of the scrotum."
E aprop layssa le cauteri ubert per so que gete brac per lonc temps.	"Afterwards, leave the cautery buried in order that it may burn for a long time."
E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	"And do not remove the cautery until it has done its work properly so that two intentions are aggregated to it, and then it will be quickly removed with help of healing."
La forma del cauteri am lo qual es cauterizat lo ventre sia clavilh segon que la forma de aquel es desus precedent, e es aquel am le qual es cauterizat le dos sia olivar segon qu’es precedent a la sua forma.	"The form of the cautery with which the belly is cauterized should be like a clavis, following its previous form, and that with which the back is cauterized should be like an olive, as it has been previously described in its form."
Capitol .xxxii.	"Chapter XXXII."
De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas.	"Of cauterization of leprosy and of sores."
Quan les pes so apostematz en ydropitz e so repletz de aygua sitrina, cove que cauterisas les pes sobre le dos del pe in nocrati aquo que es entre le auricular e le anular, e eleva la tua ma am le cauteri e no torses aquel; e aprop eleva la tua ma, e no retornes aquela de tot, quar l’aygua satrina rezuda.	When the feet are swollen with dropsy and filled with serous water, it is necessary to cauterize the feet on the back of the foot near the area between the little toe and the ring toe, raise your hand with the cautery and do not twist that; and then raise your hand and do not return that completely, for the serous water will subside.
Es le cauteri segon aquesta forma: E aprop fay sobre las doas coyssas dos cauteris, e en quascuna coysa sia feyt cauteri am la extremitat del cauteri cutellar.	This is how you should apply the cautery: First, make two cauteries on both sides of the thighs, and on each thigh make a cautery with the cutting edge of the cautery.
E sia le cauteri segon la longitut de la coyssa: i dejos le denolh e l’autre jos le mieg loc de la coyssa; e sobre quascuna coyssa dos cauteris.	And make the cautery along the length of the thigh, leaving one on the outer side and another on the inner side near the middle of the thigh, making two cauteries on each thigh.
E layssa la plagua uberta ses curacio per lonc temps per so que alcuna aygua resuda de lu.	And let the wound remain uncovered for some time so that no water may accumulate there.
E aprop cura le am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas.	Then treat with those causes which we have mentioned.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter XXXIII
De cauterizacio de cos de ventre.	About the cautery of the belly.
Quan cos de ventre es per freg e per humiditat entro que debelice las vertutz, so es la vertut digestiva e retentiva, las quals so en l’estomac e en les budels, e es curat aquo am las manieyras de curacio e no confereys, e vezes le malaute suffertan cauteri de vertut exhiberant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am gran cauteri sobre le sieu stomac segon que a precedit en la cauterizacio del estomac, am le cauteri del cercle e am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic subtils, am cauteri clavilh subtil; e am cauteri sobre le alcatin sobre alozis gran, o am dos cauteris.	When the belly suffers from wind and moisture inside that weakens the vital powers, such as the digestive and retentive powers which are in the stomach and intestines, it is treated with these methods of treatment without conferring, and sometimes the illness requires cautery to exhibit its virtue, at that time cauterize it on the same stomach according to what has been said before about the cauterization of the stomach, with a large cautery circle and four small cauteries around it, with a small nail-like cautery; and with one cautery on the spleen near the great kidney, or with two cauteries.
E si vezes las humiditatz exhuberants e le malaute aquo tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le pentenilh e sobre les budels, e fort leu ajustant dos cauteris sobre l’estomac e prop dels inguonas, quar es curacio perficent de juvament de la qual no erras.	And if the moisture is excessive and the illness tolerates it, then cauterize on the penis and on the intestines, and closely apply two cauteries on the stomach near the groin, for this treatment is perfecting healing of which you should not err.
Capitol .xxxiv.	De cauterizacion de costelas e de bracs.
De cauterizacio de emorroydas antiquas.	"Regarding the cautery of ancient hemorrhoids."
Quan so en la natura derier emorroydas antiquas o una de humors grossas fregas o de humiditatz corrompudas, e son curadas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no confereys la tieua curacio, lahoras cauterisa am tres cauteris sobre le pus dejos spondilh del dos petit e petit triangular, e am cauteri desus le ombelic cays per dos ditz.	"When there are recent hemorrhoids or one of thick humors or corrupted humidity, and they are cured with what we have said in the division [of medicine], then cauterize them with three cauteries on each side of the small triangle below the navel, and one cautery above the navel."
E si doptas que l’estomac de lu sia enfregidat e la vianda de lu no sia degerida, e la cara de lu vezes apostemada, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre l’estomac am gran cauteri segon que es precedit; e am un cauteri sobre fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa de lu am cauteri clavilh, e leyssa le cauteri per alcun temps ubert, e aprop cura lu entro que sia sanat.	"If the stomach appears cold and the food undigested, and the face is pale and yellowish, then cauterize that area on the stomach with a large cautery as described previously; and apply one cautery to the liver, and another cautery to the spleen using a pointed cautery, and leave it there for some time until the wound heals."
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter XXXV.
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	"On cauterization near the incision of hemorrhoids."
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When thou cuttest away the vein, then thou ignitest the cautery that is assembled like a rod.
Aprop entremet aquel ignit en aquel atheyl abscis, e ultima la tieua ma entro que pervengua le cauteri al orifici de la vena de la qual ve la sanc.	Then insert this heated cauterizing instrument into the vein you have cut off, and finish closing its mouth so that the cautery reaches the opening of the vein from which blood flows.
E fay aquo una vetz o doas, quar si achieyl son trops, lahoras cauteriza quascun de lor segon que havem recontat, e aprop cura aquels am aquo que confereys a lor dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And do this once or twice, because if the veins are too large, then cauterize each one separately according to what has been said above, and afterward cure those with care using what is recommended for healing.
E si cauterizas am gran cauteri sobre alquatin, es mays derier en juvament.	And if you cauterize with a large cautery over some area, it is more likely to cause injury.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter XXXVI
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	On the cauterization of fistulas that are made in the nature of wounds in the parts of the flesh.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When nature does not obey the work recommended for it in its place, and the patient is frightened by this, then let it be healed with a cautery.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	Therefore, when there is some vein fistula in the nature of a wound, and it is old, corrupted by corruption and moisture, then what is more fitting than to probe that with a subtle probe, and also know the quantity of its depth with the aforementioned probe.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Then heat the cautery which resembles a ray.
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	And then insert this heated cautery into that fistula, according to how deep the probe enters.
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	"Burn the corrupt flesh with the cautery thrice, twice or once, according to your need."
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant.	"Be careful not to burn nerves or veins. If the fistula is in the bladder or the intestine, be especially careful with all those areas and do not perform this procedure unless the fistula is in a fatty location and you think it is not penetrating."
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	"And then treat the area once it has healed."
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	"If the area is sealed and the matter is cut off from it, and it remains like that for some time, then you know that it has healed completely."
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	"If the matter is not removed from it, then you know that it is penetrating or that the bone is corrupted nearby, or that this is due to one of those causes which will be mentioned later in its place."
Capitol .xxxvii.	"Chapter xxxvii."
De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	"Regarding cauterization of warts."
Quan en les ronhos endeve dolor per freg o per grossa ventozitat, e per aysso le coyt del malaute es amermat, lahoras cove que cauterizes aquel sobre les ronhos am cauteri sobre quascun ronho am cauteri clavilh del qual precesic la rememoracio.	"When the warts cause pain due to friction or large size, and consequently the patient's skin becomes irritated, it is necessary to cauterize each one with a hot iron, applying it to every wart with a pointed tip, taking care not to forget any."
E fort leu cauterizam am le segon un petit dejos, per que vindran tres cauteris liniatz, e donc siran mays deriers en juvament.	"And then cauterize them again with the second iron, leaving a small space between each one, so that three lines of cauterizations are formed, and then continue with more cauterizations afterwards as needed."
Capitol .xxxviii.	"Chapter XXXVI."
De cauterizacio de la vesica.	"Regarding cauterization of the bladder."
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	"When the bladder suffers debilitation and softening due to friction and humidity, such that the patient cannot retain urine, it is necessary to cauterize there on both sides of the pubic region, where the hairs of the pubis begin, applying one iron on the right side and another on the left."
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la cantitat dels not del pous; e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en la partida pus bassa del dos, o am dos cauteris si es necessitat.	"And let the length of each cautery be according to the amount of hair in the pubic region; and cauterize there with one iron on the lower part of the buttocks, or with two if necessary."
E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	"And let the cautery have a pointed tip depending on what is needed."
Capitol .xxxix.	"Chapter XXXIX."
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	"Regarding cauterization of the navel."
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	"When the navel suffers friction and humidity, making it difficult for conception to occur, corrupting menstrual flow, delaying its onset, and causing pain during menstruation, it is necessary to cauterize there with three cauterizations around the navel region, as we have described in the cautery of the bladder; and also apply a cautery on the lower part of the back, or two if necessary, using a pointed tip."
Capitol .xl.	"Chapter XL."
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	"Regarding cauterization for dislocation of the anus."
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	"When moist discharges are abundantly emitted from the anal region, causing prolapse of its tissues, and a sign of this is that one side appears prolonged over the other when compared together."
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	"And the location of the prolapse is found within the buttocks."
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	"Therefore you should cauterize the patient on the spot where the ankle bone is located using a circular cautery similar to this, since once you have felt with your hand in the area around it as it revolves, and thus that the ankle bone falls in the middle of the circle."
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	"And here is the cautery described earlier for use in cauterizing the stomach."
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	"If this cautery is not available to you, then cauterize with three olive-sized cauteries."
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And let the cautery be made according to the quantity of heat throughout the whole cord; and afterward take care that the wound may heal."
Capitol .xli.	"Chapter XL."
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	"Of the cauterization of the sciatic vein."
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	"When pain arises in the ankle joint due to friction and dampness, the patient is cured with what has been said [above] if it is not confirmed or outdated. Then you should purge the patient of thick humors using fetid pills or artificial pills, and afterward cauterize that area."
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	"And the method of cautery in this case is done in two ways: either by cauterizing with burning medicines or by cautering with fire."
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	"First of all, according to two known methods, one of which is that you should cauterize the area around the ankle joint with three triangular cauteries arranged in this manner; and make them of good depth."
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	"And let the space between each cautery be equal to the thickness of a finger, if the cauteries are olive-sized or larger."
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	"But sometimes you should place the cauteries directly on the middle point above the ankle joint, so that there are four cauteries."
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	"And if you wish, cauterize with the circle described in the cautery for dislocation of the ankle joint, so that it may contain and burn all the heat along the whole cord."
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	"And this is the method of cautery for sciatica when pain is adherent to the ankle and not extended into the joint."
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	"But if it extends into the joint, then cauterize that area with two cauteries on the joint above the point where the pain is felt; and one cautery on the shinbone a little below that point on the left side."
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	"And if cauterizing with a knife (cautery), let the depth of the cautery be according to the amount of heat in the cord."
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	"And if the pain extends to the point near the toes where you should cauterize that area with cauteries for three points or four or more as needed."
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	"And if the pain extends to the side below the joint, then cauterize that area with one knife cautery."
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	"And be sure in all cauteries not to finish with the cautery so as to burn any nerve or large artery, lest you cause harm or contraction."
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	"And I have seen some of those who cauterized on the shinbone and finished with the cautery, and the leg became swollen within so that the tumor reached the foot, and the foot was perforated and corrupted."
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	"And indeed such a careless procedure is often followed by a sudden loosening of the belly, and often death results."
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	"And if pain is in two places at once, cauterize each according to this manner."
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	"And the wise ones said concerning cauterization of the ankle joint that this is the manner: make it like a ring of iron, whose circumference should be the size of a large palm; and let its opening be on the outside according to the thickness of a date bone or slightly more."
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And let that circle be followed by another third; and let the space between them be equal to the width of a finger joint; and let those circles be opened on both sides; and let their length be one or two finger widths, and make their edges of iron decently sharpened in the circles; this is its form:"
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	"And let it be heated in the fire until it becomes red-hot and throwing sparks; and let it be placed on the party of the ankle where the pain is located on the inside."
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	"And then cauterize that area with three reddened cauteries at one time."
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"And then leave it for three days; or plaster that with mud and leave the wound open too many days; and cure it with honey until it is healed."
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Albucasis says: "O son, concerning this kind of cautery we have used it little because of the fear of its appearance and because few people regard it."
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	"But of all cauteries there is none like that one which suffers itself to be found in its place."
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	"But cauteries with adherent medicines are those which you should make two circles having holes pierced in them, into which let the end of an iron rod be inserted; let their length and thickness be such that they are two or three finger widths apart."
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	"And if the space between each is equal to the thickness of a finger; and let them be open on both sides and above, and let them contain something between them according to this form:"
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	"And let it be placed on the party of the ankle where the pain is located on the inside; and press your hand on the party of the ankle, and take boiled water and pour it between the two circles, whose heat should be increased gradually, and keep that for about an hour, until the pain has ceased from its biting and adhering — for that burns like fire — until the biting ceases."
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	"And then lift your hand with the instrument and wash off the boiled water from all the ankle with fresh water."
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	"And then leave it for three days and press on that area until the blackness of the adhering cautery disappears, and let it be so for some days, and afterwards wash it with honey; this is the last in treatment."
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"And then cure it with honey until it is healed."
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	"And if the pain extends into the thigh or leg, make to it as was done for the ankle joint."
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	"This is the manner of boiled water, and I have already written that in the treatise on the rectification of medicines."
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	"Recipe: of alkali and of soda not quenched from both an equal party, grind them up and place in a new bowl whose lower part is pierced with a small hole according to the quantity that goes into it."
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	"And place underneath the bowl another vessel inverted, and pour onto that alkali and quicklime with fresh water until it covers them by one finger's breadth; then compress them with your hand with good compression, and leave the vessel which is going to fall from it boiling water to the inverted vessel."
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	"And then tighten all that water, and pour it onto more quicklime and fresh alkali, because at this time it will have very great strength, which is administered in many medical operations and in cauterization of other members, because it acts like fire."
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	"And so of some medicines with which the ankle is cauterized, such as treacle and honey and quicklime with soap, so that they are mixed."
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	"Galen recounts of a man among the ancients the operation and cure with which pain of the ankle and sciatic vein was cured, and he highly praised it, saying that no other cure is necessary, because it is healed at once as he recounted, for it entered into bath and eased immediately."
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	"And it is that it should be taken of green celery, and if it is not found green, fig leaves should be taken; let them be ground with a little salt and placed upon the ankle where there is pain, or on the thigh or leg, and bound up."
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	"It should be left for three hours or as much time as the patient can bear without discomfort."
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	"Then immediately take him to bathe and feed him once his body is immersed in water, because the pain ceases and he becomes healed."
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	"And know that no one should use cautery with these medicines unless it's for the evacuation of the body."
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	"But as Aesculapius said, when a goat's vein is cut and the bleeding stops, he should apply a poultice to it. And this is how you cauterize: take some wool, dip it in old oil, and place it between the openings of the skin."
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	"And also take dry goat hair and heat it on fire until it becomes charcoal, then place it on the wool and let it cool."
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	"And repeat this process, and don't stop until the sensation of the bite has reached the water, and then the pain will cease."
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	"And this method of cautery is called 'cautery of goats'."
Capitol .xlii.	"Chapter XLII."
De cauterizacio de dolor de dos.	"Of the cauterization of toothache."
Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquelas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida.	"Sometimes pain occurs in the back due to various causes, such as kidney stones or blows or excessive evacuation, and for similar reasons, due to an infusion of hot and humid matter."
E cauteri no catz sino en aquesta sola specia la qual es fayta per efusio de materia frega.	"But cautery is not useful except in this single case, which occurs from the effusion of hot matter."
Donc cove, aprop evacuacio del malaute am pillulas fitidas e am semblant a lor, que sian faytas sobre·l dos en le qual es la dolor tres linhas segon la latitut de lu, pus que senhas am tentha en quascuna linha v cauteris o mays, segon la quantitat que ve de la tolleransa del malaute e de la vertut de lu.	"Therefore, first perform an evacuation of the patient with pills made from the same material as the one causing pain, placed on both sides where the pain occurs in three lines according to its width. Then apply cauteries with tenths in each line, depending on the quantity that comes out and the power of the disease."
E sia fayta cauterizacio am cauteri de punt.	"Then cauterization should be performed using pointed cauteries."
E si vols, cauteriza am tres cauteris o am quatre am cauteri clavilh medial segon aquesta forma:	"And if you wish, cauterize with three or four cauteries in a cross shape using a small knife-shaped cautery:"
Capitol .xliii.	"Chapter XLIII."
De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	"On cauterization at the beginning of gibbosity (hernia)."
Motas veguadas endeve aquesta malautia als petitz enfantz; e senhal del comensament de lu en les enfantz es que accideys sobre lor estrectura en le ale eves la elevacio e·l movement.	"It often happens that this disease occurs in young children. The sign of its onset in children is when the hernia appears suddenly while they are playing and moving around."
E atrobas en le derier espondil del dos e dels notz de lu que ja comensa a sobremontar sobre les autres spondils.	"And you should notice that it occurs at the last lumbar vertebra of the spine, where the hernia begins to protrude over the others."
E donc quan tu vezes aquo e voles prohibir, lahoras cauterisa aquel am cauteri que sia cercle segon aquesta forma:	"And when you see this and want to prevent it, immediately cauterize around that area with a circular cautery like this:"
que prengua le cauteri sobre tota partida del spondilh engualment.	"so that the cautery covers all of the protuberance of the vertebra on both sides."
E si vols, cauteriza en le circuit del spondilh am le cauteri de punt dos linhas o tres.	"And if you wish, cauterize around the circumference of the vertebra with a pointed cautery in two or three lines:"
E sian les puntz propdas entre lor.	"so that the points are close together."
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat am aquo que havem dit.	"And then treat the area inside that has been healed as we have said."
Mays guarda que cauteri no sia administrat en gelbositat que sia fayta per spasme de nervi.	"But be careful not to use a cautery in cases of hernia caused by spasms of nerves."
Capitol .xliv.	"Chapter XLIV."
De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	"On cauterization for gout and pain in the joints."
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament.	"When pain in the joints is caused by friction of humors that accumulate in each part of the body, it is customary for physicians to call this condition gout specifically when pains occur in the feet."
E donc cum es curada podagra de causa frega am manieyra de cura e no so remaugudas las dolors, lahoras las remau cauteri.	"And therefore, when gout caused by friction is being treated with medication but the pain does not disappear, then cauterize to remove it."
E es que tu cauterizas aquel aprop evacuacio en le circuit de la junctura del pe am motz cauteris.	"and you should cauterize around the evacuation area of the joint of the foot using several cauteries:"
E sia cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And these cauteries should be olive-shaped, with this being their form:"
E si es necessitat que puntz sia fayt sobre la fassia del pe, lahoras fay am cauteri de punt.	"If it is necessary to make points on the fascia of the foot, then do so using a pointed cautery."
E si las dolors pujan entro als denolhs o a las autras juncturas, e aquo motas vetz s’endeve, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre quascun donolh am tres cauteris o quatre de tota partida am aquest cauteri olivar.	"And if the pain moves into the toes or other joints, and this happens many times, then cauterize around each painful area with three or four olive-shaped cauteries like this:"
E si motz cauteris que aquestz cauteris sian a tu necessaris, lahoras cauteriza aquel e no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri abans, sia tant solament enviro la specitut de la codena.	"If many cauteries are needed and these cauteries are necessary for you, then cauterize like this without pressing too hard with your hand before the cautery, being careful only around the skin of the joint."
E si las dolors pugan entro al donolh e·l dos, lahoras aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le sieu capitol.	"And if the pain moves into both toes, then administer the cautery as we have said in its chapter."
E si las dolors so en las mas tant solament, e es apelada suagra, lahoras puncta en le circuit dels focils ayssi cum se revolvo, puncta en aquels dos linhas.	"And if the pain is only in the joints of the hands and it is called arthritis, then make punctures around the knuckles like this, making two lines of them."
E si reman de las dolors en les ditz, lahoras puncta en le cercuit dels focils sobre quascun notz e sobre la pinche de la ma.	"And if there remains some pain in the fingers, then make punctures around each knuckle and around the root of the thumb."
E si las dolors pugan aprop alscus jorns als coydes o als muscles, lahoras cauteriza les quascus de tota part dels ajutoris.	"And if the pain moves near to the joints of the bones or muscles, then cauterize each of them on all sides of the tendons."
E no evacuas le malaute de bon regiment e de recepcio de medicinas, quar si es fayt bon regiment e flacma es evacuada am aquest cauteri sira sanat, Dieus ajudan.	"And do not evacuate the disease without good regimen and receipt of medicines, for if there is good regimen and the humor is evacuated with this cautery alone, God willing, it will be healed."
Capitol .xlv.	"Chapter XLIV."
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	"On cauterization of fractures."
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	"When a fracture occurs in the ankles or shins and the bowels begin to be obstructed before they reach the anus, you should order the patient to leave off food for that day and to use gentle laxatives so that the obstruction may pass from his belly."
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	"And then place the patient between your hands on his back, and order him to hold his breath until the anus is open or the bowels appear."
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	"And then return him with your hands and gently press the fracture onto the bone of the hip, making sure that the end of it is like the middle of a circle on both sides of the body."
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And then heat the cautery which has this shape:"
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	"until it becomes very red-hot and emits sparks."
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	"And then reduce the bowel or anus to its convexity, and quickly place your hand over it so that the bowel does not escape."
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	"And you have already placed yourself between the thighs of the patient and one thigh is paused with your hand, and another servant holds one of his limbs and another holds his foot, which should be held firmly."
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	"And then place the cautery on that sign with your hand and straightener, and apply it until you succeed in reaching the bone of the hip in the middle of the joint; repeat this procedure again if you do not succeed at first."
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	"And be careful to observe the sensation of the bowel during your cauterization, so that you do not burn it and thus bring about the death or another serious injury to the patient."
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	"Know that if with the cautery you do not reach the bone, your operation is ineffective."
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	"And the cautery for children should be fine according to their size and proportion."
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	"And afterwards, care for the place of the cautery with a soft cloth for three days until the scar of the burn is removed."
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"And then care for him with other remedies until he is healed."
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	"And the patient should lie on his back for forty days until the place and the wound are sealed."
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	"And you should pause the patient's nutrition according to the length of time for his cure, which loosens his belly, and so that the bowel does not protrude due to the effort of healing."
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	"And when he wants to get up after forty days, then administer suitable food to him and have him lie on his back for another forty days."
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	"And he should be careful about work and exercise, food and drink, and loud voices, for if he follows this regimen of healing perfectly, he will surely be healed."
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	"I have spoken of the treatment of fractures in other parts of the belly, and at the beginning you wish them not to remain. Therefore cauterize the fracture with a round cautery according to its size, and it should be that which is taken from the bone as far as the third division of it; then care for him with what we have said, but do not follow this rule."
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	"And some first authors say that fractures should be cauterized with a triangular cautery according to this shape, for it is marked with a point thus:"
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	"And a line is drawn along the length of the side where the fracture rises and another line above it. Then place your hand with a pointed cautery, but let the first cautery be lighter and better."
Capitol .xlvi.	"Chapter XLVI."
De cauterizacio de torcio.	"On cauterization for torsion."
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	"When pain occurs in some members due to overexertion or blow and persists for a long time without being relieved by treatment with medicines, then cauterize with a pointed cautery."
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	"And let the cautery be of suitable size according to the magnitude and smallness of the member, its strength and weakness, location of the torsion and intensity of the pain."
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	"If it is not healed by the first cautery, that is good; but if not, then repeat the cautery. For such pains are often pierced in a member near to the one affected, so you must reach those with your cautery until the patient is healed."
Capitol .xlvii.	"Chapter XLVII."
De cauterizacio de lepra.	"On cauterization for leprosy."
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	"Some lepers are viewed with caution due to great harm and little improvement, especially those whose condition is caused by decay of phlegm and melancholy."
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	"Therefore, when you wish to cauterize this one, consider if the leprosy is common or already cured according to what we have said in the division above. Do not give it, if there isn't any, and fear that the corruption might spread throughout their whole body and entire complexion. Therefore, cauterize this one on the head with five cauteries: one in the middle of the head, another towards the end of the hairline, and two on both horns; and one behind, on the nape or servants."
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	"And lastly, burn the cauteries slightly within so that they leave a small impression on the bone, and remove the scabs from them, so that the expiration of thick vapors is relieved. Then cauterize on the chest according to what is necessary."
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	"And if the leprosy has already spread over the malady and appears manifestly, then you should cauterize this one with those cauteries which we have mentioned for the head; and cauterize on the extremity of the nose with two cauteries on each cheekbone, two on both shoulder blades, six on the spinal processes of the back, and one large on the spinal process near the coccyx, one on the coccyx itself, two on each ankle, one on each heel, two on each toe, two on the knees, and two on the muscles. Cauterize this one over all the joints of these members and feet, and on each sole of their feet, and on the cushions of their soles."
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	"And beware that you do not cauterize those nerves which are situated on the sole that you may not burn them."
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	"And sometimes it is cauterized with one cautery on the bone of the breastbone and another on the mouth of the stomach, and another on the liver."
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	"And know that the more closely you apply cauteries, the greater is the benefit and advantage. And know that the patient feels no pain from the cautery as they do with their own sores, because the body of the sufferer is already anesthetized."
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	"And it is necessary that the cauteries be large or small according to the members and joints according to what is prescribed by the species of instruments."
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	"And afterwards, cure the wound with a poultice made of bran, honey, and the other remedies until it is healed."
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter XLVIII
De cauterizacio de stupor.	**On cauterization for stupor**
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	"When a limb is paralyzed or numb and treated with medicines, oils, and plasters yet is not healed, then cauterize that paralyzed limb with cauteries according to the size of the limb or its smallness."
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	"And your cautery should enter just a little into the spine of the backbone."
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"Then dress it with ointment until it is healed."
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	"And sometimes it happens that some paralysis which is close to the hip or foot, and near the spine of the back where the nerves that move that limb originate, is removed after cauterization."
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	"But one should not presume to do this unless he is knowledgeable in the anatomy of limbs and the exit of nerves throughout the body that moves everything."
Capitol .xlix.	"Chapter XLIX"
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	"On cauterizing warts that have been disfigured."
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	"When warts are old and do not disappear with the usual remedies of medicine, then cauterize over that one with a hot cautery iron slightly according to the quantity of the thickness of the spine of thewart until it is removed the whiteness and color of it, and its color is changed."
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	"Then dress it with flour of earth and lentils mixed with rose oil, and leaves of sage, and dove's blood or hen's blood, giving each one part and mixing them all together, and then apply a cloth and place it on the spot until it is healed."
Capitol .l.	"Chapter L"
De cauterizacio de cranc.	"On cauterizing warts."
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	"If cancer begins and you wish to destroy it, then cauterize around its circumference with a circular cautery iron as it turns."
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	"And they say that it should be cauterized with the last cautery iron in the middle of it; but I have not seen this, for I fear that it may become ulcerated, and I have seen it happen sometimes."
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	"And it is better that it be cauterized around its circumference with a circular cautery iron as we have said, or with many cauteries."
Capitol .li.	"Chapter LII."
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	"For cauterization of varicose veins."
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	"If some varicose veins are delayed in maturation, this is due to the superfluity they produce, or the condition of the patient, who is elderly and decrepit with little blood, or due to time, and you wish to hasten the maturation of varicose veins; then cauterize around them using small puncturing caustics."
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	"But if you wish to perform the cauterization with a hot iron, then heat the cautery of which this is the shape: and press it on the middle point of the varicose vein until it penetrates the cord."
E si le cauteri en aquel loc que es pus dejos, per so que le cors del brac sia alleujat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And if the cautery in that place is put on too strongly, so that the course of the vein is alleviated; and then cure it until it is healed."
Capitol .lii.	"Chapter 52."
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	"On cauterization of corrosive substances."
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	"Corroding corruption wanders through the limbs, which corrodes them as fire consumes dry wood."
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	"If you wish to cauterize that corrosion with fire, then heat the iron instruments accordingly, both small and large ones according to what is appropriate for that area being corroded."
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	"And similarly cauterize it thoroughly within so that you may eradicate all the corrosion and leave no cause of it remaining."
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	"And leave that alone for three days, and then dress the cauterized areas solely with oil mixed with salt so that all scars may be eradicated and all corruption."
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	"And afterward treat it with engendering flesh."
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	"But if after three days the flesh does not grow back healthy and uncorrupted, then you should repeat the cautery on that which remains in the corrupted areas."
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	"And sometimes corrosion is treated with acute medicine, for it serves as a means to cauterize instead of fire."
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	"But nonetheless cautery by fire is the most gentle remedy."
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	"And I have already spoken of the treatment with acute medicine in the division, and therefore take that when you begin."
Capitol .liii.	**Chapter 53.**
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	**On Cautery for Wounds and Similar Conditions.**
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Often seen in the parts left by the sick foot that is called claw, and it is a thick, solid cause which presses on the foot; and cautery in these cases follows two manners: namely cautery with fire and cautery with cold water.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	Cautery with fire is done using a cautery device similar to the shape of a vulture's feather quill, which should be made of iron according to the size that contains the claw on each side, and it should have fine edges.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	Then pause the heat of the cautery device on the claw and then slowly move your hand with the cautery device around the circumference of the claw until it reaches the depth of the claw.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	Leave that for three days until it begins to scar over
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	Then apply a poultice made of crushed wild mallows mixed with salt on that area and leave the poultice overnight, because it will draw out its roots.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the location with an ointment made from fatty tissue until it is healed.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it does not improve, and often happens on the surface of the body, especially in the hands and feet, then you should administer cautery with cold water in those cases. Take a canula made of bronze or iron or vulture feather, and place it on the claw; then pour a little cold water into the canula, and hold your hand still, pressing the edge of the canula onto the root of the claw while allowing the cold water to flow through the opening at the front of the root of the claw. Wait for a moment until you feel the bite of the cold water for about an hour, then remove it, because the claw with its roots will be eradicated.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	Do likewise to the others until all of them are eradicated from your body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	Then cleanse those pustules where the roots of the claws have been eradicated with an ointment that causes the flesh to grow.
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter LIV
De cauterizacio de tremor.	On cautery for trembling.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When someone has trembling due to inflammation of the nerves or fever caused by heat, or for another similar reason, then you should perform cautery on them with four cauteries or five, placed on the vertebrae of the back, between each vertebra with one cautery; and also place a cautery on the sole of their foot and on their stomach, using an olive-sized cautery.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And may his trembling cease, and may his health be restored quickly from the burning illness.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter LV
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	On cautery for accidental wounds of the body
