When this condition occurs in many men, such that the eyelid is solidified upwards with the albumen of the eye, and prevented from its natural movement and functions, then you must insert the tip of a needle underneath the eyelid and raise it up, or extend it with tweezers.
E aprop tu inscideys la adherencia am spatum subtil, le qual no sia am acuitat de las inscisios, habantz obtus un petit per so que·l malaute no sia inquietat deves la operacio, e remau le spatum que no ledesca le huel am la sua acuitat.	And then you cut the adhesion with a fine scalpel, which should not have too sharp an edge, taking care to make it blunt enough so that the patient is not disturbed by the operation. Remove the scalpel carefully so as not to hurt the eye with its sharpness.
E sia la tua inscizio quays excorjan aquela adherencia am facilitat entro que sia retornada la palpebra segon la sua forma natural e que sia sanada tota la adherencia.	Make your incision such that it easily cuts through the adhesion, ensuring that the eyelid returns to its natural shape and that all adhesions are healed.
E aprop tu met en le huel aygua salada am la qual tu laves; o distilla en lu de zunia dissolvut en l’aygua.	Then you apply saltwater to the eye, with which you rinse it; or distilled water dissolved in honey.
E aprop separa entre la palpebra e l’huel am calgua de li, e pausa sobre le huel lana infuza en album de huou, e aprop le tertz jorn usa de causas consolidativas entro que sia sanat.	Then separate the eyelid from the eye using a cotton swab dipped in egg albumin, and apply a compress soaked in egg white to the eye. On the third day, use healing agents to promote healing of the wound.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI
De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	On Incision of Nail and Removal of Carnal Protrusion from Lacrimal Ducts
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	You should know that there are two kinds of nails: one is nerve-like, similar to hard, fine matter; the other is not nerve-like and resembles congealed white humor. When you cut this latter type with a knife, it can be easily gripped with tweezers and then removed without the tweezers getting stuck inside.
E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel.	Both kinds of nails begin only in the larger lacrimal ducts and gradually increase, covering the eye and preventing light and movement of the eye.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en la inscizio de lu es que·l malaute pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop obre les huels de lu, e eleva la palpebra am la tua ma, e aprop colligeys la ungla am onci de pauca duplicacio e exten aquela a las partidas desus.	To operate for the incision of this nail, the patient should hold their head still and look up. Then open the eye widely with your fingers and lift the eyelid with your hand. Using tweezers with little duplication, grasp the nail and gently pull it upwards at its ends.
E aprop pren una agula e entromet en aquela un pel de cavalh o de buou o de vaqua, o de semblantz, o de fiel fort, o duplica la extremitat de la agulha petit a petit e fica aquela en le mieg de la ungla, e penetra aquela am la agulha, e lia am fiel la ungla; e exten aquela a las partidas desus, e excorja am le pel le latz de la ungla lo qual siec la pupilla.	Then take a needle and thread through it a horsehair or cowhair or oxhair or similar strong hair. Fold the tip of the needle and insert it into the middle of the nail. Then pass the needle through the nail and grasp it with forceps. Gently pull the nail upwards at its ends, and carefully remove the lateral edge of the nail that covers the pupil using the thread.
E ayssi tu sieguas aquela am le pel entro al derier de lu.	And so you continue removing it until the end is reached.
E aprop tu inscideys le romanent en la razitz del lacrimal am spatum subtil o am petitas forfexs, e leysa la carn del lacrimal natural per so que per inscizio de aquela no endevengua fluxs de lagremas continuabla.	Then incise the remaining nail at its root using fine scissors or small forceps. This will release the natural lacrimal tissue and prevent continuous tearing from occurring due to the incision.
E alscunas vetz la ungla am le sol onci estenduda o am fiel, ayssi co havem dit, e aprop sia excurjat am spatum leon del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And sometimes the nail can be removed with just one pair of forceps or with forceps alone, as we have described. The form of the spoon-shaped knife used for this purpose is as follows:
E guarda te que am le spatum no toques la tunica cornea e que avengua en lu ruptura, e que la pupilla sia perforada.	And be careful not to touch the corneal tunic with the spoon and avoid breaking it. Also ensure that the pupil is not pierced.
Aprop la inscizio geta en le huel un pauc de sal trissa o di cief fayt de siniar, e leyssa aquel entro al autre dia; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	After making the incision, apply a little salt water or rosewater to wash it and leave it for another day. Then rinse it with clean water and dress it until healed.
E si la ungla no es nervoza e no podes metre la agulha, ni es ficada en aquela le onci, lahoras motas veguadas aquesta specia de ungla es curada am medicinas, e es sanada ayssi cum yeu e recomtat en la divisio.	If the nail is not nerve-like and you cannot insert the needle or grasp it with tweezers, then sometimes this type of nail can be treated with medications. In such cases, follow the methods described in the division (treatment) section.
E si tu vols inscindir aquela, lahoras tu obre le huel del malaute e pren spatum subtil leon de freul acuitat segon aquesta forma:	If you wish to incise the nail, first open the patient's eye and take a fine spoon-shaped knife made of sharp steel with a point like this:
am subtilitat.	Sharp and subtle.
E si vezes que aquela es rarificada e es confugida e empren en aquela razit, lahoras distilla de la tua ora en le huel de cief fayt de siniar o am cief rog o am sal trissat, e opila le huel entro a l’autre dia.	If sometimes the nail is rarefied and condensed, and adheres to its root, then distill some of your saliva into the eye with rosewater or with boiled water or salt water. Then close the eye for another day.
E aprop itera sobre aquela la operacio entro que sia remaugut tot aquo que es de lu, sino que·l contrari apostema caut sia en le huel, quar lahoras tu leyssa aquela, e cura al comensament la apostema entro que sia sanat.	Then continue the operation until all of what remains is removed from the eye. But if a counter granuloma has formed in the eye, then leave it alone and treat the granuloma at the beginning until healed.
E aprop itera la tua operacio sobre aquela am razo entro que sia sanat.	Then continue your operation on that nail until it is healed.
La emenencia de la carn lacrimal, si notz en le huel per gran nocument, sia suspendut am onci; e inscideys aquela de aquela una partida, e no ultimes la inscizio per so que no inscidesqua fluxs de lagremas.	"Suspend the eyelid with a hook to avoid great harm. Incise the upper one first, and do not cut too deeply to prevent tears from flowing."
E aprop distilla en le lacrimal cief rog e fayt de siniar entro que sia sanat.	"And subsequently, distill water into the lachrymal sac through a small opening so that it may be healed."
Capitol .xvii.	"Chapter XVII"
De inscizio de alguazardenic e de aquo que es nascut de carn ajustada en le huel.	"The incision of an abscess and about what is born from attached flesh in the eye."
Alcunas veguadas en les huels de alcus es nascuda carn roga, e es sobre-pausada entro que cobre la pupilla, o apropinqua o estrenh sobre las palpebras e fort leu comprem las palpebras a las partidas deforo e es assemblada a roza de balaustra.	"Sometimes in the eyes of some people, flesh is born that grows over the pupil, or approaches it and presses between the eyelids, forcing them apart, like the petals of a flower."
Mays la operacio en lu es que·l malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se; e aprop obre les huels de aquel e colligeys tota aquela carn am oncis convenientz ad aquo, e te aquo am una forcep o am cesti; e aprop inscindiys la carn el comensament entro que tot sia finit am le encisori, e guarda te del huel que no ledescas aquel deves la tua operacio.	"First, operate on the head where the patient rests their chin. Then open their eyes and collect all that flesh with appropriate hooks. Remove it with forceps or basket, then cut away the flesh at its beginning until everything is finished with the scalpel, taking care not to damage the eye during your operation."
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscides aquelas o am espatum le qual nos havem recomtat en la inscizio de la ungla, o am petitas forfexs am las quals es colligit ascebel segon que vindra la forma de lu aprop aquest capitol.	"And your incision should be made with the same scalpel that we have recommended for nail cutting, or with small forceps, according to what comes next in this chapter."
Donc cum es complida la tua inscizio e es remauguda tota aquela carn, lahoras omple le huel de sal trissa, o destilla en lu polvera roga e semblantz a lu de las medicinas corrossivas, e pausa sobre le huel deforo coto am album de huou entro que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	"Therefore, once your incision is complete and all that flesh has been removed, fill the eye with finely ground salt or distilled powder like those used in corrosive medicines. Then apply a bandage made of egg white to ensure that no infection occurs."
E si roman alcuna causa de alguardenici e es senhoragat sanc caut, e temes apostema caut, lahoras leyssa le huel e cura aquela apostema am aquo que ceda aquela apostema, e aprop itera sobre aquel am operacio entro que sia sanat, e semblantment fay en la carn ajustada la qual accideys en le huel de aquesta especia.	"And if there remains some cause for inflammation and infection appears, and you fear an infectious abscess, then leave the eye alone and treat that abscess with whatever will heal it. Then repeat your operation until it is healed, and do likewise for any attached flesh that occurs in the eye of this sort."
Mays empero tu cove que alienes tota curacio del huel freul per via natural o per via accidental, obran am ferr, e no metas la tua ma en alcuna de aquestas operacios entro que veges que aquel membre sia suffertant aquela operacio.	"However, you should avoid all care of the eye by means of herbs or any other accidental way. Do not use iron instruments or put your hand in any of these operations until you see that the member can withstand the operation."
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII
De colleccio de sabel en le huel.	On collection of cataract in the eye.
Sabel so venas rogas las quals son testudas sobre le huel e prohibeysso al vesement la sua operacio, e develican le huel am longitut de dias.	"Know that veins become hardened on the hip and hinder its movement; alleviate this condition over several days."
Donc necessari es al comensament que tu consideres si le huel en le qual es sabel es fort e en lu no es autra malautia que sabel, lahoras tu colligeys aquel sabel.	"Therefore, at the beginning, you must consider whether the hip in which there is sciatica is strong and does not have another ailment called sciatica. Then collect that sciatica."
E es que tu comandes al malaute que pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop suspen aquelas venas am un onci o am dos segon la tua prudencia; e sia aquel onci de subtil duplicacio segon aquesta forma:	"And you must command the patient to put their head on your shoulder, and then suspend those veins with an ounce or two according to your judgment; and that ounce should be of fine doubled thread."
o so dos oncis gradantment en un cos segon aquesta forma:	"or two ounces gradually in a body like this:"
E aprop sian colligidas aquelas venas am forses subtils, am subtilitat, e abstergeys le sanc hora aprop hora, entro que vegas aquelas venas esser remaugudas del huel e sian revolgudas.	"Then bind those veins with fine forceps, carefully and gently, and wipe away the blood little by little until you see those veins become detached from the hip and turned over."
E guarda te que tu no ledes le huel am las extremitatz del spatum; e si’ la tua operacio en le miegjorn denant le solelh, e sias mot ferm en la tua operacio que no inscidas sino aquelas venas.	"And be careful not to cut the hip with the sharp ends of the spatula. And if your operation is done in the midday before the sun, and you are firm in your operation, do not cut anything but those veins."
E quan tu auras complitz, lahoras tu distilla en le huel cief vert o rog per que am sa acuitat corrodesca aquo que es remaugut del sabel.	"And when you have completed this, then distill on the hip chief white or rose water because with its sharpness it will corrode what is detached from the sciatica."
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible colligeys tot en aquela hora, e lahoras tu emplastra tot am aquo que cede la dolor de lu, e leyssa lu per alcus dias entro que sia sedada la dolor de lu e que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	"But if this is not possible for you to do all at once, then plaster it all with that which relieves the pain of sciatica and leave him like that for a few days until the pain is calmed and assured against inflammation."
E aprop itera sobre lu segon que la mateyssa manieyra entro que sia sanat.	"And then iterate upon it according to what seems best to you until he is healed."
E aquesta es la forma de las forfexs:	"And this is the form of the forceps:"
Capitol .xix.	"Chapter XIX."
De reduccio de arizati al nas.	"On the reduction of nasal fractures."
Quan tu curas arisati am cauteri o am medicina aguda comburent segon que es precedida la narracio de lu e no es sanat, lahoras no es engen en lu sino que fendas sobre le apostema deves la maturitat de lu, e que extraguas tota la humiditat la qual es en lu e·l poyre entro que sia descubert le os.	"When you treat fractures of the nose with cautery or with burning medicine according to what is prescribed in its narration and it does not heal, then do not engage in it unless you cut above the swelling when it reaches maturity, and remove all the humidity that is in it until the bone becomes visible."
E donc cum es descubert le os e vezes en lu corrupcio o negror, lahoras tu ratz lu am un sturment del qual aquesta es la forma:	"And then, when the bone becomes visible and you see corruption or blackness in it, then scrape it with an instrument of which this is the form:"
E es nompnat de aspre cap, e sia feyt de fer indi, e sia le cap redon ayssi cum asir le qual sia fayt punctat per punctacio de lima o aliskalfati per punctacio subtil (ayssi cum es en la forma seguent).	"And it is called 'rough head' and should be made of iron, and the head should be round like this: pierced with points for piercing with a file or awl for fine piercing (as in the following form)."
E pausa aquel sobre le loc corrumput del os, e aprop revolveys aquel entre les tieus ditz, e prem la tua ma petit a petit entro que sapias que aquela corropcio es rasa.	"And place that upon the corrupted part of the bone and then turn it between your fingers and press your hand little by little until you know that the corruption is scraped."
E aquo sia fayt alcunas veguadas, e aprop restaura le loc am causas exsiccativas e stipticas.	"And do this several times, and then restore the area with drying and astringent causes."
Donc si·l loc es consolidat e es en lu nascuda bona carn e es abscindit le cors de la sania e roman per xl dias, e no es renovat e no es apostemat e no accideys en lu accident, lahoras tu sapias que es sanat.	"Therefore, if the area is consolidated and good skin has been produced in it, and the flesh has detached from the bone and remains like that for forty days, and there is no renewal nor inflammation nor any accident in it, then you will know that it is healed."
E sino, lahoras no es en lu engen sino reduzir la fissura a la forma del nas, e segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu descuebras de segon os am ferr o am medicina acuta, e cum sira descubert le os, lahoras tu pren tribo segon aquesta forma:	"If not, then do not engage in it unless you reduce the fracture to the shape of the nose, and according to this manner: and that is when you uncover the second bone with iron or with burning medicine, and when the bone becomes visible, then take tweezers of this form:"
Sia la extramitat de lu ferr triangulada, e·l fust de lu sia prim extenuat entro a la extremitat ayssi cum vezes assi.	"The tip of the iron should be triangular, and its stem should be thinly tapered to the tip as shown here."
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le os, e sia aquel prop del lacrimal; e alongua la tua ma un pauc del huel, e aprop revol la tua ma am le tribo entro que penetre tot le os, e aquel sente le malaute per asso que atroba vent yssir per so quan te la sua ma.	"And then place that upon the bone and let it be near the lacrimal; and extend your hand a little away from the helmet, and then turn your hand with the tweezers until all of the bone enters, and he will feel pain because you find vent issuing forth there when you have his hand."
Donc lahoras restaura le loc am medicinas stipticas exsiccantz ayssi cum t’e eyssenhat.	"Therefore, then restore the area with astringent drying medicines as you have learned."
Donc cum nays la carn e·l loc es endurazit, lahoras la materia la qual effundia a las partidas deforo retorna al nas, donc aquo es pus leugier sobre le malaute.	"Therefore, when the skin is healed and the area has become hardened, then the matter that flowed out to the parts outside returns to the nose; therefore, this is gentle about the pain."
Capitol .xx.	"And Chapter XX."
De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	"On the reduction of the prominence of the helmet."
Quan le huel emineys am la sua totalitat e no accideys en le vezement nocument ni diminuacio, lahoras cove que laxas le malaute, e aprop que·l segues, e aprop que pausas ventozas en le cervitz ses scarificacio e succa per bona succaccio; e aprop pausa sobre le huel liniment le qual sia fayt de acatra e aloe e enses e sarcocolla, e aprop strenh le emplaustre sobre le huel am motz polvils.	"When the helmet is prominent with its totality and no harm or diminution occurs in its appearance, then it is necessary that you alleviate the pain, and then follow this: place vents on the nape of the neck without scarification and suck well; and then place upon the helmet a liniment made of aconite and aloe and frankincense and tragacanth gum, and then apply poultices to the helmet with hot powders."
E la manieyra dels polvils es que prenguas draps de li leons motz, e quascun drap sia duplicat en quatre plecs; e fay de aquels motz.	"And the manner of the powders is that you take drags of lions' teeth and each drag should be folded into four pleats, and make them thus."
E aprop pausa aquels la un sobre le autre segon la quantitat de la qual ha le huel necessitat.	"And then place those upon one another according to the quantity that the helmet requires."
E aprop strenh sobre aquels am drap dur am fort strictura; e itera las ventosas am succio ses scarificacio; e aprop osta las ventosas e leyssa le huel streyt le dia e la nueyt.	"And then place upon them a hard cloth with strong binding, and repeat the cupping with suction without scarification, and then remove the cups and leave the helmet bare day and night."
Mays si entretant le liguament es mollificat, lahoras cove que sia mot streyt.	"But if meantime the bandage becomes softened, then it must be made tight again."
E aprop osta le liament aprop le dia e la nueyt ayssi cum havem dit.	"And then remove the bandage day and night as we have said."
E si vezes le huel ja esser redusit, bo es, e sino, lahoras itera le emplastre am les polvils e la strictura e las ventosas entro que sia sanat.	"And if the helmet is already reduced, that is good. But if not, then repeat the poultice with the powders and binding and cupping until it is healed."
Capitol .xxi.	"And Chapter XXI."
De la inscizio de la eminencia de la tunica uvea.	"On the incision of the prominence of the tunic of the eye."
Quan endeve disrupcio en la tunica uvea, e aprop es eminent e procezeys fora las palpebras ayssi cum un gra de rasim, e es orrazada la forma de home per aquo, e vols aquo inscidir, lahoras la operacio en lu es ayssi cum havem recomtat, que tu entrometas la agula en la razitz de la uvea de la partida dejos en la partida desus, e aprop met la agula autra en la qual sia fil doble de la part del lacrimal, e fay aquela penetrar e leyssa la primieyra agula segon la sua disposicio; e aprop inscideys le loc del fiel doble e leva am aquel la partida de la uvea en le circuit de la agula, e strenh aquela mot.	"When there is a disturbance in the tunic of the eye and it becomes prominent and projects outside the eyelids like a grain of mustard seed, and appears rough like this shape of a man, and you wish to incise it, then the operation here is as we have recommended: that you insert the needle into the prominence of the vein from below above, and then insert another needle with doubled thread on the side of the lacrimal, and make that penetrate and leave the first needle according to its disposition; and then incise the location of the doubled thread and lift away with it the part of the vein in the circuit of the needle, and pull that tight."
E aprop extratz la agula e pausa sobre le huel lana infusa en album de huou e leyssa entro que cayha le fil am la uva.	"And then extract the needle and place upon the helmet wool infused in albumen of a fowl and leave it there until the thread with the vein falls out."
E aprop cura le huel am aquo que conforte aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	"And then treat the helmet with that which comforts it until the wound is healed."
E alcunas veguadas aduna de tota partida am cercle de drap entro le huel ajuste eminencia gran, e aprop sia perforat am le spatum subtil que vengua al preon del huel, e corra la humiditat albuginea, e descen le huel e intra tantost.	"And sometimes it happens that the whole part adheres with a circle of cloth onto the helmet's prominent eminence, and then it is perforated with a subtle spatula that comes to the front of the helmet, and runs the albumen humor, and descends the helmet and enters immediately."
E aprop strenh entro que sia sanat.	"And then pull until it is healed."
Capitol .xxii.	"And Chapter XXII."
De curacio de alconati.	"On the treatment of inflammation of the eye."
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	"This illness called inflammation of the eye is nothing but heat that adheres to the helmet like descending water, and it is not this."
Mays la manieyra del obrar en ela es que fasses le malaute sezer sobre la sela aparelada e dreyta, e aprop pren le cap sieu en las tuas mas de doas partz e mau aquel entro que veias la sania pervenir a las partidas dejos, e aprop sia siccada e no descenda, e sia ostat le lum, e·l malaute veia las causas ayssi cum vezia.	"But the manner of treating this is that you make the illness cease upon the prepared and straight saddle, and then take your head in both hands and move it until you see the heat coming to the parts below, and then dry it so that it does not descend, and close the light, and the illness sees its causes as if seeing."
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	"And if it does not descend below, know that it is water."
Mays si no es preparat le descendement a la sania am aquo que havem dit, lahoras fay le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e aprop pren spatum subtil e fen am aquel sobre le pannicol cernent un petit deves la continuacio de la conjunctiva am la tunica cornea en la corona (entro al loc vuet), entro que sia fora-getada la sania.	"But if the descent of the heat is not prepared with what we have said, then make the illness cease between your hands and then take a subtle spatula and wound it upon the skin surrounding a little below the continuation of the conjunctiva with the tunic cornea in the crown (as seen), until the heat is expelled."
Donc cum es fora-getada, lahoras tu distilla en le huel aygua cauda en la qual has mesclat mel o aygua en la qual ja has bulit fenugrec e mel.	"Therefore when it is expelled, then distill upon the helmet water infused with honey or water in which you have boiled fenugreek and honey."
E aprop sia curat am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then it should be treated with other causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Capítulo XXII
De la curacio de la aygua descendent del huel.	Of the treatment of descending water from the head.
Ja havem dit las specias de la aygua en la divisio e qual conveneys a perforar am sermo declarant, lahoras aquel segon la sanetat.	We have already spoken of the kinds of waters in division and which are suitable for boring with clear speech.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre un cayrat e lia le sieu huel sa, lu mot stringent.	Then you must place the patient between your thighs on a cushion and grasp their head with both hands, pressing firmly.
E aprop pausa prop de la palpebra del sieu huel la tua ma senestra, si le huel en le qual es l’aygua es le huel senestra; o am la tua ma dreyta, si le huel es le dextre.	And then place your left hand near the eyelid of their left eye if the water is for the left eye, or your right hand if it's for the right eye.
E aprop am la tua ma dextra pren almagda, si le huel es senestre; o am la tua ma senestra, si le huel es de dreyt.	And then with your right hand take some salt if the eye is left, or with your left hand if it's right.
E aprop pausa la extremitat de almagda prop de la corona per la grossesa del ray en le album del huel de part del mendre lacrimal, e aprop enpelleys almagda am vertut e revol la tua ma am aquel.	And then place the tip of the salt near the crown of the eye for the thickness of a ray in the white of the eye from the direction of the tear duct, and then press the salt gently with your hand on that.
E aprop penetre en le album del huel e sentas que almagda ja es pervenguda a causa vueda.	And then penetrate into the white of the eye until you feel that the salt has reached the bottom of the tear duct.
E cove que sia la masura del cami de almagda al preon la mesura del spazi le qual es de la pupilla entro a la fi de la negror, e es la corona del huel; quar tu veyras am aquel pupilla am la visio de l’huel per la clartat de la tunica cornea.	And the measure of the path of the salt should be like the measure of the space which is from the pupil to the end of the darkness, and that is the crown of the eye; for you shall see with that the pupil with the vision of the eye through the clarity of the corneal tunic.
E aprop pausa almagda entro al loc en le qual es l’aygua, e aprop tu la atira en jos una veguada aprop autra, e donc si la aygua descen tantost, lahoras vetz le malaute aquo sobre le qual huebre la sua vista tantost, e almagda en le sieu huel.	And then place the salt into the location where the water is, and then gently squeeze it once or twice, and then if the water descends quickly, at that moment you will see the illness about which this person has been complaining quickly disappear from their eye, along with the salt.
E aprop repausa se un pauc; donc si la aygua es descenduda, lahoras tu depausa aquela autre veguada abantz que almagda ne sia getada.	And then pause for a moment; and if the water has descended, then gently squeeze again but be careful that the salt is not spilled.
E donc quan es sicada e no descen, lahoras tu extrat almagda am facilitat, e revol am aquel la tua ma pauc a pauc, e aprop dissolveys en l’aygua un petit de sal clara de gemma e am aquela lava le huel dedintz; e aprop pausa fora le huel coto o stopa o lana infusa en oli rozat e album de huou e ligua am aquo le huel sa.	And then when it has ceased and does not descend any further, then gently remove the salt with ease, and then turn it slowly with your hand again and again, and then dissolve a little of finely ground rock salt in water and with that wash the inside of the eye; and then place something outside the eye to stop it, such as cotton soaked in rose oil and alum and lint and bind it thus onto the eye.
Mays nos e aquels que so de nostre temps pause sobre aquel comi trissat am album de huou.	But we who are of this time pause on that which is written with white albumen.
E si no obezeys a tu almagda al intrament de l’huel per la sua duricia — quar es alcu dels homes del qual le huel es dur mot —, lahoras cove que prenguas le spatum le qual es nompnat alberid del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if you do not succeed in inserting the salt into the eye due to its hardness - for it is one of those men whose eye is very hard - then you must take the spatula which is called an "alberid" and which has this shape:
E donc perfora am aquel aquela conjunctura, e no ultimes la tua ma en le trauc, e no es si no que fassas via ad almagda loc subtil.	And then pierce with that the conjunctiva, but do not push your hand too far in and do not hesitate to make a way for the salt to reach its subtle location.
E aprop entromet almagda segon que havem dit.	And then insert the salt as we have said.
E deves le compliment de la tua obra, sia preparat al malaute dormitori descentment fayt en le qual dorma sobre le sieu dos en mayson tenebrosa, e sia prohibit de totz movementz .	And you should complete your work by preparing the patient to sleep in a room with the lights off where they can lie on their back without any movement.
E pausa en la natura de lu aquo per que sia linida la sua natura, e no maugua le sieu cap a la partida dreyta ni senestra de tot.	And pause the nature of the water so that its nature is clear and do not move their head to either side or up or down during this time.
E sia le liament segon la sua disposicio entro al tertz dia.	And let the bandage be according to its arrangement in place on the third day.
E aprop deslia aquel en aquela maysso tenebrosa e exproha la freol vista, e fay li vezer alcunas causas, e aprop retorna le liament entro al dia .vii.	And then untie that one from that darkened room and expose them to the open air view, let them see some things, and then return the bandage on the seventh day.
E no cove que fassas aquo en la hora de las curacios o tantost aprop la infusio.	And do not do this during the hours of darkness or immediately after a bath.
Habantz cove que tu alienes aquo per so quar la aygua puega leugierament per gran e vehement de reguardament.	Be careful to avoid doing this for someone who has an abundance of water, because water can play gently on the large and vehement eye.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que deslias le huel denant le vii dia, e rectifica aquel am aquo que ceda apostema.	But if an abscess forms, then you must remove the bandage from the eye on the seventh day and correct it with something that will cause the abscess to burst.
Lahoras tu absol la vista de lu e pausa sobre la cara de lu oral per le qual sia regit le vezement de lu dejos lu per alcus dias, lu existent en la mayszo tenebrosa.	Then uncover their eye and pause on the face of their mouth so that they can regulate the movement of their gaze up and down for a few days while remaining in the darkened room.
E aprop sia gitat de aquela mayzo gradantment e conversa8 en las suas causas.	And then gradually lead them out of that room and expose them to things slowly.
E sapias que in alchatea no es excusat le discipol de visio alcunas veguadas, e lahoras tu sias ardit sobre la operacio.	Know that in alchemy, the apprentice is not exempt from having vision some times, and therefore you should be bold about performing the operation.
E ja es pervengut a nos de alcu de aquels les quals so al Artach , e alcu disse que fayt foc en al Ayrac magdaam perforat am le qual es succada la aygua.	And it has already come to our knowledge that some of those who are knowledgeable in alchemy have said that one should make fire in the Alchemical Furnace called "Magdara" pierced with which water is sucked up.
Mays empero yeu non e vist degu en la nostra terra le qual haia perfeyt aquo, ni e aquo legit en alcu dels libres dels antics; e es possible que aquo sia novel.	But however we have not seen this done in our land nor is it written in any of the books of the ancients that this has been perfected; and it is possible that this may be a new thing.
E aquestas so las formas de las specias de magdaan per que sia sobre aquelas aquel le qual ignora aquelas:	And these are the forms of the species of "magdara" so that they can be understood by those who do not know them:
E sian faytas de eram o de ferr propriament, e sian las extramitatz de lor am aquesta subtilitat triangulada, la extremitat aguda ayssi cum aquela es la forma.	And they are made of brass or iron properly, and they have these extremities with this triangular subtlety, the extremity sharp thus as that is the shape.
Capitol .xxiv.	Chapter XXIV
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	On the treatment of flesh torn in the nose.
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	When in the nose there are diverse pieces of flesh attached from which one cause is that it is assembled like a scorpion with many feet, or like a polyp with weight; and this illness is called "polyp" because it resembles that fish represented.
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	And its flesh is cancerous, pale, of dark color; but the lion's flesh is not of dark color.
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	Therefore in that which is in these lion-like but not fraudulent or cancerous flesh, you should squeeze the illness between your hands and put it in the sun, and draw out its moisture and cut off those pieces of flesh.
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	And then extract that from the openings of its exterior, and then cut what you have comprehended of those with a sharp subtle spatula on one side until you know that all the flesh is removed; but if there remains any cause for which amputation is possible, then remove it with one of the subtle instruments easily so that nothing remains.
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	But if there is bleeding or an abscess forms, then pause until it stops naturally; but if they are malignant abscesses, then cut and cauterize that until the bleeding stops and all cavities are opened.
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	And then sprinkle it in the nose with wine vinegar and water or wine.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	But if the nose is open and from it proceeds moisture into the palate, then you know that it is healed.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	But if the moisture does not penetrate as it should, then you know that there is still flesh torn on the projecting bones of the nostrils which have not received amputation.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore you should then insert lead into it which has some thickness, and push it in the most of its nostrils, and pause between each push for the amount of one finger or more, and generate the illness and insert an extremity of the lead into the nose with wax or with another cause that is possible.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And after that has been done, let them throw their head backwards so that the odor reaches the canals of the nostrils, and let it be poured over their throat, for several times children at school do this action and it is an easy cause for anyone who wants to do it.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	And then pause the two extremities of the lead, one extremity that exits over the nose and the other that remains in the nose, and then administer a suture of flesh on the holes that are in the lead, and do this until you know that the flesh is with the holes of the lead.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	And then extract the lead, and pause in the nose with the abstraction of blood once a day, and do this for three days or more until the ointment corrodes all that remains of the flesh.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And then at the end of the cause, pause in the nose a cannula of lead for seven days until it is healed.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	If you intend to treat by cauterization, use the cautery.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	This is the form of the purge-making instrument with which oils and medicines are distilled in the nostrils:
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And make this of silver or copper, resembling a small open lantern, like a small jug, and the mouth likewise.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you wish, make it a closed cannula like a reed, and the cannula of the purge-making instrument should be flat and open; have a handle on its end with which to hold it when pouring in the oil or water that you want from the saps and succulent causes.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And these purgatives are precious: Take of castor oil, white balm, ginger root, saffron piltre, long pepper, scabious, ephedra seed one dram. Concoct with the sap of beet and celery, and make them into pills; take one pill dissolved in hot water and administer it to the nostrils of the sick person lying down.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter XXV
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	**Of the thills or wicks that are placed at the extremities of the nose.**
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Many times it happens that the eye appears in the extremities of the nose, and is enlarged and swollen during those days when much attention is paid to its care.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And for this reason you should insert it at the beginning of the appearance of that, and erase everything after that.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	Moreover, pause over the place where cauterization or medicine burns is situated instead of it.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	But if its insertion is delayed until it has become enlarged, then consider whether it is hard, thick, dark in color, and insensitive. If this is the case, do not touch that with iron because it may be a malignant carbuncle. Many times that which you have inserted into this carbuncle becomes stuck there due to great mischief on that person.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the carbuncle is of a reddish color and not dark in color, sometimes insertion may be possible everywhere. In this case, evacuate the morbid matter and insert without fear, and cure the place with something that dries and constricts until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter XXVI
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of the suture of the nose, lips, and ear when continuity has been dissolved by an ulcer or wound.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Know that when there is a dissolution of continuity in one of these cartilages (the nose, lips, or ear), little confidence should be placed in that operation, except with certain skilled individuals.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when you encounter such a cause in someone, first examine whether it is a fresh wound with its own blood. Then immediately approximate the two lips of the wound with suture and apply proper dressing until healed.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of the continuity have already separated and each is free from infection, then it is necessary to cut off each end of its apparent cord until there is no bleeding.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then closely approximate the two lips with suture and press them together. Then sprinkle dragon's blood powder on it and apply a poultice of diaphoretic plaster or another consolidative plaster, leaving that dressing for two or three days before removing it and replacing it. Leave it until the wound has healed by itself.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	But the manner of suture is to join the edges of the continuity either with needles as recommended for abdominal closure, or else with thread in such a way that you know how to do it.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter XXVII
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Of the extraction of those causes that come between the two lips within wounds
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Many times it happens that in the midst of the lips of wounds there are hard pimples resembling pig fat, some small and others larger.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	"Therefore you should examine each of those hardnesses and divisions, and then make an incision in the place where the blood is concentrated, wash it with vinegar, and dress the wound with something that has astringent properties until it heals."
Capitol .xxviii.	Capítulo XXVIII.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	Chapter XXVIII: On the Incision of Adherent Tissue in the Gums
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	Often there appears on the gum adherent flesh which the ancients called albulus; therefore you should suspend it with forceps or hold it with your fingers and cut it off at its root, allowing the sound tissue to bleed freely.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	And afterwards apply to the place where it has been cut a powder that is both astringent and cicatrizing.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if that flesh returns, cut it again afterwards, and cauterize it so that it does not return again.
Capitol .xxix.	Capítulo XXIX.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	"Due to teeth made of iron."
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When the surface of the teeth in both jaws and those in front are tightly sealed with rough, sharp, thick deposits, sometimes blackened, and have green or yellow pus between them and the gum, this indicates decay and the teeth are loose.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	Therefore you should seize the patient between your hands and place their head on the pillow of their bed, hold open their mouth in which those deposits appear and cause such sand-like grit to arise from them that there is no cause for any decay, and this is done with respect to blackness and yellowness and other things that are altered.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	Therefore if this is what you want in the beginning of the reason, well then; but otherwise, later you should repeat the reason on those days two and three until it comes to its final statement in what you wish.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that teeth require various types of tools with different shapes and forms according to the preparation for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And therefore choose the rasp with which you remove the tooth from within the teeth that is different from the rasp with which you scrape between the teeth in other ways. These forms of rasps should be prepared by you, as you will soon see:
Capitol .xxx.	Capital thirty
D’eradicacio de dentz.	Extraction of teeth
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	But when you care for a tooth with all your skill and patience in its extraction, there is no reason why the vision should not be clear once it has been extracted, because it is a substance that becomes sublime during the extraction.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	But if the patient is forced to have a tooth extracted, you must be absolutely certain which is the painful tooth, for often the pain seems to come from a healthy tooth, and you extract one while the pain continues until the truly diseased and painful tooth is removed, as we have seen happen in barbers' operations.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore, when you are certain which is the painful tooth and know it well, then you should scarify around the tooth with spatula in which there is some virtue, until it is dissolved from the gum completely severed, and immediately remove that with your tweezers, or with subtle forceps bit by bit until it comes out.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And then with strong forceps hold the tooth firmly for good traction or extraction, and pause the head of the patient between your thumbs so that you may have it well held that it does not move, and extract the tooth directly in such a manner that you do not break it, nor cause greater pain to the patient.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And then if it is not forgotten, take one of those instruments and put it behind the tooth on all sides with ease and effort to loosen it as was done at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is cracked or decayed, then you must fill that crack and strengthen it with the extremity of a fine wire before tightening it with forceps on that tooth.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And you must work carefully with scarification around all sides of the gum and guard your strength so that you do not break it or cause it to shatter apart from it, and return on the patient for greater good than the first pain of him.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And beware that you do not do what some ignorant barbers do in their haste and audacity to eradicate teeth without administering what we have recommended; for many times they cause great illnesses upon men which are more difficult to treat than the tooth itself, and leave behind roots of removed teeth all together, or some of those, or extract it with some bones of the jaw as is often testified.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And when extracting it, wash the mouth with hot water or vinegar with salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if there are flows of blood from that, as often happens, then take some quantity of sage and sprinkle it on the wound, and if it does not suffice that sage, cauterize.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The form of the forceps and fine tweezers with which the tooth is held at the beginning should be of long extremity, short handle, and thick, so that they are not bent when using them.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And let them be thus shaped with grooves on the inside of the thick handle such that when you tighten with those, they are not bent, and have short extremities.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And let them be made of wrought iron, straight-edged, and on the extremities have teeth that interlock with each other for strong tightening, and sometimes the extremities are shaped like the beak of a bird called ciconia, which is wide, and they are of great force.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter XXXI
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	Of the Extraction of Teeth and the Extraction of Bones of the Jaw that are Locked together
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you must extract a tooth that is stuck for some reason, then you should pause on the place with warm water for one or two days until that place is softened; and then introduce instruments or tweezers whose extremities are shaped like the beak of a bird called ciconia or wide-mouthed, in this way:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The extremities of their limbs are affected in such a way as though they were scraped or filed.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	If you do not obey to this command with these forceps or tongs, then you must cut over the wound and remove all flesh and insert the instrument called thus, which is a small lever whose shape is as follows:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And its end should be thick but short, and not bent in such a way that it does not catch.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Therefore, if the wound is forgotten because of this, it is good. And if not, help yourself with these other instruments, whose forms are as follows: The first instrument has a triangular shape with some thickness at its end
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The second instrument should be triangular and have a very thin tip
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And then, helped with this instrument having two branches, whose shape is approximately as follows:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	And also with other instruments which are like teeth for cutting, because much help is obtained with this instrument which resembles a large nut, and this is its shape:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	Of triangular tip bent or short, which has some thickness, and not bent in such a way that it does not catch.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And you should know that the instruments of moving teeth are also similar to other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	But the skilled and subtle craftsman finds for himself mates according to what he understands about the operation and various diseases. Because there are some diseases for which the ancients did not give or leave proper instruments because of their diverse forms.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the bone of the jaw or other bones of the mouth is broken or pierced, then it should be carefully treated on that spot with whatever is convenient among the instruments and forceps which we have mentioned in the extraction of tooth roots, and help yourself with this gesture whose shape is as follows:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And let there be some thickness little by little, and let it be bound or held with the mouth so that it does not escape or flee until the bone is completely forgotten. And then restore the spot with appropriate medicines for that.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a small perforation in the bone, then remove that from that perforation and its blackness, and treat it until it heals.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	Of the care of prominent teeth above the others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	"When teeth emerge misaligned from their natural course due to form or are especially noticeable in women, particularly venerable elderly women; therefore, consider: if one tooth is too close to another and no shifting or ligature is possible, then extraction may be necessary. However, if it is not attached to another tooth, then cut that one with this instrument, whose shape resembles a pig's snout, made of sharp-edged Indian iron."
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	"And if your incision does not cut through the tooth in three days due to its hardness, do not attempt to remove another tooth."
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	"If it is an erupted tooth with an eminence requiring filing, then file it using this Indian iron file, whose shape is as follows:"
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	"And it is entirely made of India iron and sharp-pointed; and its cutting edges are thus like a file with which teeth should be filed little by little in many days with ease, so that no other tooth is injured or damaged."
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	"And appropriately smooth it at the end, then polish it with pumice stone."
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	"And if it is a tooth with a broken edge that irritates the tongue, then you should grind down that rough portion until it is smooth and flattened, so that the tongue is not injured and speech is not impeded."
Capitol .xxxiii.	"Chapter XXXIII"
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	"Of restoring broken teeth with gold or silver foil."
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	"When teeth are broken by concussion or removal due to percussion or falling, and the patient cannot chew their food, and you have treated it with astringent medicines, but your treatment has not been effective, then it is proper to restore those that are strong with gold foil, not silver, because silver turns green over time, but gold never changes."
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	"And the foil should be made thin and fine according to the amount that can fit between the teeth. The method of preparation is as follows: take the foil and fold it twice between two healthy teeth, then carefully twist the folds of the foil between one or more broken teeth so that it reaches the healthy part of the other tooth."
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	"And then continue the filling within the portion where you began, and carefully press your hand with ease and skill so that it is not broken."
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	"And make sure to press the foil tightly against the roots of the teeth so that it does not become loose."
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	"And then cut off the excess ends of the foil with forceps or scissors, gather them up at each location, and bend them down and hide them between the healthy tooth and the broken tooth, so that they do not injure the tongue."
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	"And then press it tightly as with wax."
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	"But if it becomes loose or broken, then repair it or them with other foil in this same manner at all times."
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	"And this is the form of teeth and the figure of the restoration of two healthy teeth and two broken ones, as shown in this drawing:"
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	"And when one or two teeth return to their proper place after falling out due to concussion and have been restored as we have described, but still become broken again."
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	"And this is only done by skilled and knowledgeable artists."
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	"Sometimes it is appropriate to use bones from cattle. They are shaped like teeth and placed in the location where the tooth has failed. It is then bound tightly as we have said, and remains there serving for a long time."
Capitol .xxxiv.	Capítulo XXXIV
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	Chapter XXXIV
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	"This ligament which sometimes prevents the tongue from moving or is naturally present but accidentally occurs due to phlegm that has already congealed."
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	"And the operation on it is that you open the patient's mouth, lift their head back if necessary; elevate their tongue and carefully cut that nerve ligament according to its length until the tongue is freed from its recess."
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	"Moreover, if there is any hardness or firmness there, and this is due to the consolidation of phlegm, then you apply oil and cut it open along its length until you have severed the ligament and dissolved the firmness."
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	"And make sure that there is not too much opening of the flesh wound, and be careful not to sever any artery or cause bleeding."
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	"And carefully wash the wound of the incision with warm water or vinegar water or fresh water; and then leave the tongue at peace, that is, keep the patient's mouth closed in each night so that it does not become consolidated again."
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	"But if bleeding occurs, apply powdered alum to the location; but if the blood continues to flow, then cauterize the location with a hot cautery that is suitable for this purpose."
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	"And also treat it with other causes according to how it is healed."
Capitol .xxxv.	"Chapter XXXV."
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	"For removal of a ranula from under the tongue."
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Sometimes, a small tumor resembling a pea grows under the tongue and hinders its natural movement.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	The operation involves opening the patient's mouth widely towards the sun and examining the tumor.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you find it to be dark colored or black, hard, and the patient feels no pain, then do not touch that which is cancerous.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it is inclined towards whiteness, indicating humidity, then you should use a spoon to remove it, and carefully cut that thin sputum with scissors, cutting it entirely; but if blood comes during your operation, then pause for a moment until the bleeding stops, applying some powdered vitriol to restrict its flow.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then return to your work until you have removed it completely with care, rinsing the wound with vinegar and salt; and heal it with another cure until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Capítulo XXXVI
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	Chapter XXXVI: Extraction of Tumors from the Ears and Those Found in the Throat, as Well as Other Tumors.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When there are tumors in the throat that are swollen glands which sometimes become enlarged and protrude externally, these are called "ears," and when you treat them with water as mentioned earlier but they do not heal, then consider whether the tumor is hard, dark colored, and causes little pain. If so, do not touch it with iron.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	"It is of red color and has a large root, therefore do not touch it with iron due to blood flow. Rather, let it remain until it ripens, then you shall remove it or break it apart yourself."
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	"If it is white in color and has a fine root, then that one should be incised."
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	"And before your operation, consider the condition of the abscess: whether it has already ripened and is fully ready, or if it has decreased in size with some diminution. Then make the patient lie down facing the sun, with their head towards the east, open their mouth wide, and the servant holding their tongue with a suitable instrument, whose form is as follows:"
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	"And it should be made of silver or brass, and be sharp like a knife."
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	"Then, while pressing the tongue with that instrument and exposing the abscess to you, take courage and cut into it at once, inserting the knife gently into the opening and pulling outwards as much as possible."
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	"After that, if some of the tunics come out along with it, then immediately cut them off with this instrument, whose form is as follows:"
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	"And it resembles forceps, but its ends are curved such that the tips of each face inward towards the other, being very sharp, and made of iron with a brass inlay."
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	"But if this instrument is not available to you, then cut it with a scalpel whose form is as follows: It should be sharp on one side and not sharp on the other."
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	"And after making one cut, make another according to this same method of incision. Then wash the wound clean with water."
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"But if there is bleeding from the wound, wash it clean with water from a decoction of rosehip or myrtle leaves, adding to that any of the astringent causes at hand until the bleeding stops. Then dress the wound until it heals."
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	"And sometimes you may find other abscesses near those two ears, and cut them according to what I have said regarding the incision of two equal cuts."
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	"And now I will tell you about a woman who was afflicted with an abscess that had formed in her groin. It was dark colored and insensitive, the wound had already closed up, she was breathing with difficulty, and eating and drinking water were prohibited to her. She would have died within two days or less if something hadn't been done."
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	"And the abscess had grown so large that it had produced two branches that extended out through two tracks."
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	"I then carefully inserted my hand into one of their orifices and pulled out that which was stuck there, and indeed a large portion of it was drawn out. Then I pushed in the other end that I could comprehend of the other passage, and then I opened its mouth and compressed its tongue. Then I left the orifice in that abscess."
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	"And indeed a large part of it was cut off from him, and only a little blood flowed from him."
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	"Then the swelling of that woman subsided, and she immediately began to drink water, and indeed she took food. Therefore I did not cease to insert into that abscess many times over a long period of time, and it succeeded in healing the abscess in place of that which was prolonged."
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	"So I then took a cautery and burned the swelling of it, so that it might be completely removed. Then I wandered around and did not know what God had done with that one."
Capitol .xxxvii.	"Chapter XXXVII."
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	"On the Incision of a Swelling When It Is Abscessed."
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	"When catarrh descends to the swelling and it is abscessed and prolonged, then it is called perpendicular. And if it is located on the side of a fat person and is round, then it is called bubo."
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.
