Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	"A young man of about 30 years old experienced pain in his thigh. An apostema had formed on the inside of the thigh, extending into the body so that the apostema was large. The cause was not external."
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	"And then much time passed with that because of the error of doctors in not opening up the apostema. Much matter flowed out from it, and its treatment was stopped until the leg became fistulous. Many openings appeared in the flesh around the wound which all released putridity and the humidity of the body."
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	"Then many doctors gathered around for two years, but there was little knowledge among them regarding this matter."
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	"And he saw the bed and the blood flowing from him, as if from a great wound; but his body was already stiffened and its color was yellow."
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	"And then I inserted my finger into one of those wounds and reached the bone."
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	"Then examine carefully all the orifices and find those which come from all parts of the chamber."
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	"And then you take and cut upon one of those orifices which you discover a part of the bone, and uncover that corrupted one, and it was already rotten and corrupt and dirty; and already a part of the chamber had rotted into which it had penetrated to the middle."
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	"And then you close that which I had discovered and prepared of the bone uncovered."
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	"And you knew it was not in the bone but in that corruption which you cut out and closed, and you had already removed."
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	"Indeed, we paused the restoration of the plague by consolidated medicine for a long time, but it was not consolidated."
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	"And indeed you opened and discovered upon the bone secondly upon the first discovery, and found continuous corruption with the bone."
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	"I closed what appeared to me from that corruption, and indeed you performed fair the cure of it and restoration, but it was not restored."
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	"And then you discovered upon it again and did not cease to cut into the bone little by little particularly and perform the restoration of it, but it was not restored until you cut around about a palm's width, and that extracted with its marrow, and indeed you restored that with medicines, and it is consolidated lightly and healed."
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	"And it is not necessary to repeat the operation and section of it unless for the disposition of the frailty of it and for the scarcity of its tolerance of it and fear of death because it lies in all hours for superfluity of evacuation and bad syncope."

"Therefore, healed is by entire healing, and nothing remains in place of hard flesh; and it is well disposed in its proper body and returns its virtue; and it has been converted in its dispositions and does not do anything contrary to it in ambulation nor harm in any cause."

"But if it is prominent in place of the body already broken, then you should section it in this manner: and that you take linen and strengthen it on the extremity of that prominent bone, and command someone to stretch it out thus; and pause that linen bandage as thick as the first bandage; and indeed lay it upon the flesh that is distant from the bone, and extend the extremity of it so that you draw the flesh away from its sides, and you uncover the flesh on the place where you wish to saw, so that the saw does not touch the flesh."
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	"And pause a piece of wood or board on the side of the bone decently, for when you do this the saw is not prohibited from cutting the corrupt flesh."
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	"And it is necessary that the sawing be done little by little on the corrupted place, for if it is in the concavity of the bone corruption and does not appear in its appearance to the touch, force may have to saw it again."
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	"And if the bone is corrupted and not prominent, then it is one continuous part with another, and the corruption is in the middle place or in a part of it; therefore you uncover the flesh from all parts altogether; and indeed pause wood on that side, and indeed saw it from the first part where the corruption is until it is continuous with the sawing of the other part."
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	"And let the sawing be done according to the place of the corruption little by little, as we have said."
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	"And if the corruption is at the joint, then incise that corrupted joint and saw the bone where it is continuous with the other part."
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	"But if from the corruption is in the continuity of two joints, then it is not reasonable but ingenious."
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	"And if the corruption is in the palm of the hand or foot it is very difficult; however you should inquire how the corruption appears to you, and remove that, and cleanse it according to each disposition which is possible for you, and with every ingenuity correct what you can, so that it does not harm vein or nerve."
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	"And know what are the incising tools and the saws for incising these bones are many according to the situation of the bones, and their preparation, and their thickness, and their subtlety and greatness and smallness, and their hardness and rarity; therefore you should prepare all kinds of appropriate instruments for that operation."
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	"And know that this operation signifies to you about the kind of instrument which you need; for when you have great study and long experience in the ways of this art, and knowledge of the ways of illnesses, then already you would have by yourself what is convenient for each illness among the instruments."
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	"And I will tell you in conclusion of this chapter the number of instruments which you will prepare with them simply with which you will proceed to your prohibition which you will experience on others."

De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	"Of bone incision extremities and of bone sawing."
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	"Extremities can be affected either by intrinsic causes or extrinsic causes, whether you have medicated that corruption with curative medicines and the cure does not occur, or sometimes the corruption goes to the member which you do not perceive for any cause; therefore it is necessary to incise that member where the corrosion approaches, so that the illness escapes through that opening from death or harmfulness that is greater damage to the member."
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	"And the sign of that which happens is that the member becomes black where it was covered by fire, or the darkness approaches where putrefaction has entered into that member which seizes it and takes all the body; therefore it is necessary to incise that."
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	"And similarly if corruption is caused by the percussion of some venomous causes such as those of sea scorpi
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	"And if the corruption or percussion is at the tip of the finger, therefore you must incise the finger and not give space for the corruption to go into the hand."

"And similarly if it reaches the hand, therefore you must incise that at the radius of the forearm, and not give space for corruption to take hold in the forearm."
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	"And if you lift that one up, then cut into the arm between the elbow at the joint."
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	"And if another passes over corruption and envy near the joint, then death is there for the patient. And administering another cause other than that in cure is quantity of virtue."
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	"And likewise you must do to the foot when corruption reaches its end, then cut into it at one of the toes."
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	"And if you take the sole of the foot, then cut off all the foot."
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	"But if it can enter into the knee, then cut into the back at the joint of the knee."

E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	"The manner of cutting off a limb or sawing it is that you stretch the ligaments at the place where you wish to cut, and stretch another ligament over the spot. And extend one ligament towards both sides, and extend another ligament above them. And separate the flesh which is between two ligaments with a wide knife until all the flesh is exposed. Then it may be cut off or sawn."
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	"And it is necessary that bandages of linen be applied from all sides so that the spot does not touch. And that a proper and healed scar come to the patient."
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	"But if bleeding happens while working, then cauterize the spot carefully, or apply some powders that restrict blood. And return to your treatment until it is completed."
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And then bind the member with a bandage in whatever way is convenient, and care for it until it is healed."
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	"And I tell you this that happened to a man in his foot, the accident which I and you are discussing, which is the fourth of its kind that occurred on his foot with burn-like inflammation resembling fire combustion."
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	"And this corruption happened initially in his toe so that it affected all the foot."

"And then that man prepared to have the treatment done on his foot with great haste because of its severe pain and burning sensation. He cut off that foot at the joint, and it healed."
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	"For a long time afterward, that same corruption happened on his finger of the left hand."

"And then he came to me, and I treated him for that swelling with what I applied on his hand for medicinal purposes. E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	"And he called me to cut off his hand, but I did not want to do that hoping for the recession of that swelling. And moreover, I feared the cutting off of his hand because the power of the illness was in its root."
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	"And since he left me, he returned to his land and came back to me saying that that man had prepared himself and cut off his whole hand, and it healed."
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	"And I have not related this story now except to be helpful about what can happen with this illness, and that it may be a sign for which it is signified and according to which it should be treated."
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	"Concerning the treatment of sinus and the quality of cleansing with medicines."
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	"When an abscess occurs in some fleshy members and the space of the abscess is prolonged until it forms a collection of pus, and then it ruptures and opens up, and the pus comes out, and the spot remains hollow like a vessel, and the cord that is above it appears thus like a thin cloth, and there is no return to corruption, and it does not imprint on bone or nerve or ligament, it is called a sinus, and it is not named fistula."
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	"But if the space is prolonged until corruption impresses on some member, then it is called a fistula and not a sinus."
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	"And the treatment of it is to cut off that cord entirely as it is rolled up, and especially when it is thinned out and made like cloth, and ensure that it does not adhere to the spot because of its corruption."
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	"But if you hope that the cord will adhere and that that corruption has not yet progressed further, and there is space in the cord for scar tissue to form, then you should treat it with a cleansing enema."
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	"And if you are considering the sinus, then if it is large and the arm that goes out smells badly, then cleanse it with Egyptian medicine which is made of oil, sour wine, and cinnamon received in equal parts, ground well together in a vessel, and cooked on the fire until it becomes thick like honey."
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	"And then take some of it that is necessary and dissolve it with water and honey. And cleanse the sinus with it, and strengthen the opening of it, and leave the medicine in it for the quantity of two hours."
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	"And then remove that with a probe. And do this for so many days until the sinus is cleansed and the corruption is removed."
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	"And sometimes it is cleansed with water of ashes when this medicine is not present. And if you take the ash of vine, and put it on top of the water, then boil that and cleanse with it until you are convinced that the sinus is completely healed."
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	"And if the illness does not tolerate Egyptian medicine nor water of ashes, then cleanse it with water and honey well mixed together, and cleanse with it wine and honey mixed together. For it is the property of honey to cleanse and wash, and wine makes the sinus adhere, especially when there is excess thickness and dryness in the wine."
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	"And when you do this several times and you are convinced that the sinus has been removed, then cleanse it with something that causes flesh to grow there."
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	"And if you take some powder of diachylon and dissolve it with rose oil and thick wine, or cleanse with other medicines and ointments that have properties which I have already written about in the treatise on ointments."
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	"And if the opening of the sinus is narrow and cannot receive the tube of the cleansing, then widen it gradually with a small iron instrument, and pause there while covering it with Egyptian ointment or Basilicon ointment until it is widened."
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	"And similarly if the opening is wide, then sew up its lips with stitches and leave in it only the quantity into which you can insert the cleansing without adding anything else."
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	"And if the opening of it from which corruption goes up to its parts above is elevated, then dry that in the pus itself where it is located so that the arm may run freely downwards, for when the arm is confined within the tightness of a sinus, flesh will be produced there."
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	"And if it is not possible to dry the sinus in the area of the pus itself according to your desire, then perform an operation on the member such that corruption goes out from it lightly according to what you have learned and that there is nothing retained within it causing obstruction."
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	"And take medicines that consolidate the sinus conveniently according to what you want to extend them over, placed on linen cloth."
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	"And the linen should be of such quantity that it covers all the communication of the sinus; and properly cut with scissors on the right side of the opening of the sinus a strip somewhat wider than the opening of the sinus, and immediately extend over other linen cloths of ointments according to the quantity of the strip, and place it over that at some distance from the opening of the sinus so that it may alleviate the discharge of corruption from there and not cover too much of the linen except for a few days once."
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	"He who stands over the opening of the wound should remove that which is stuck in it at all times, lest it come out again from the arm."
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	"And how to know if what comes out of the arm is too much or too little, digested or undigested?"
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	"And also consider the location of that wound: whether the patient feels pain there or not, and if it is an abscess."
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	"And when your treatment has continued in this manner for a while, and you see that the matter expelled from the wound is now adhering, then on the third day untie it. And when you untie it, immediately change the bandage for another one and renew the ointment."
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	"But if from the wound a subtle virus escapes over a long distance, do not despair of its adhesion, for the healing of it will be appropriate; because some people have slow generation of flesh in their wounds, and others have rapid."
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	"And if after many days the arm remains undigested, you will know that the wound does not adhere. And if the adhesion of the wound is delayed and this is due to prolonged treatment, then adjust the drying properties of the medicines. And if the medicines are humid in substance and virtue, they should be dried like a fine ointment, when there is an excess of addition of zinc."
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	"And the final advice in this treatment is that you should take a little bit of ointment and dissolve it in rose oil, and put it on an ancient cloth, and apply that to the wound. And use it thus."
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	"And also do this action when there is no wound: take ointment and honey that has been cooked until it thickens, and use it. Or else take myrrh, aloe, and resin, crush everything together and powder it over the honey while it is on the fire. Then spread it on cloth and apply it to the wound. Also spread that same honey which you have cooked until it thickens, then powder it on cloth and apply it."
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	"And sometimes the treatment should be administered with long and thin roots of celery (which is celery) and flour of barley and centaure. Use these simples or adjust them, crush them and sift them and powder them over the honey that has been recommended. And use it."
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	"And if the wound is prolonged and not healed by this treatment, you should know that the corruption is in the bone of it. Then make an investigation in the bones or in the other hard members or ligaments. Therefore treat it with fistular cure, as is said above."
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	"On the treatment of cornified and thickened nails and nail trimming and finger amputation and sectioning."
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	"Panarici is an abscess that appears on the nail of the thumb or toe of the hand or foot. It commonly occurs on other fingers as well. And when it is prolonged and its treatment is delayed, it becomes a chronic abscess, or it becomes corrupted and rotten, so that it eats away at the root of the nail. And often the entire nail is corrupted, and its corruption extends to the bone, causing a foul odor. And the tip of the finger becomes reddened, and the color of it becomes dark."
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	"And therefore when you have that which we have spoken of in the division and your treatment does not help, then it is necessary for you to cut away with iron all the superfluity that remains of the nail. And also cauterize the wound immediately after that, because cautery is very helpful in this case."
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"But if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, but the corners of the nail begin to press on the flesh inside, causing it to be pricked and painful, then you should make a subtle incision at the corner of the nail that is pricking the flesh, and push it up and cut away that flesh easily. And apply to that which remains of the flesh medicines that are corrosive until everything is removed. And then cure it with ointment until it is healed."
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	"But if the corruption has already reached the bone, then you should cut away the bone and extract it, because there is no time when bone that is corrupted will heal."
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And if the corrosion and corruption extend to the finger, then you should cut it off at one of its joints according to where the corruption is most prominent. And then cure it until it is healed."
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	"But if the nail receives a blow or bruising and there is violent pain in that place, then you should first perform bloodletting for the disease. And then dry the nail with a sharp spatha using a transverse section from top to bottom. But make sure that the section does not reach the flesh that is under the nail, because if it does, you will cause violent pain and cause excessive flesh to form in that place. And then cure that place with something that relieves pain."
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	"But as was said above, this condition is found in most men. It is often entirely flesh-colored, and sometimes it is on the bones or sometimes it is on the nail."
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	"And some of them are born at the root of the joint, or their origin is in some joints of the fingers."
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	"But that which is born in some joints of the finger does not cause pain. And that which is born at the joints often causes pain."
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	"And of those that are born flesh-colored, the section is easy. And you should cut it off at its root with a broad spatha."
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	"But of that which is born at the root of the joint, the treatment is difficult. And therefore beware of cutting it off."
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"But in that which is born in the finger between the joints, you should first cut away the flesh of it with a round incision down to the bone. And then saw it off with one of those appropriate saws for this purpose. And then cure it until it is healed."
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	"But consolidation which occurs in the fingers between their joints viewed externally or by nature of the person who is born with it, or by scarring or burning of fire, or by resemblance, then you should remove that consolidation until the fingers return to their natural form."
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	"And also put between their bandages pieces of soft wool soaked in rose oil so that they do not become consolidated too easily. And separate them with a thin sheet of lead if necessary, or put one between them to prevent consolidation as needed."
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	"And likewise, if consolidation occurs in some of the fingers on the palm, then you should remove that consolidation according to what is prepared and appropriate for the figure of the member."
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	"Regarding cutting off superfluities, there are six types."
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	"Vices are varicose veins. And there are six types of veins that are wrapped around thickly and full of melancholic superfluity which occur in many parts of the body. And they most commonly occur in the legs, especially in those who travel, work physically, or carry heavy loads."
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	"Therefore you should administer a purgative for the body of black bile several times with strong evacuation. And then perform bloodletting from the basilic vein."
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	"But the treatment of them with iron is done in two ways. The first way is to cut and draw out that black blood. And the second way is to elevate the vein and extract all of it."
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	"The section of it is done in this way: first moisten the leg with cold water from above so that the thick blood is resolved, which is like a sediment of the leg. Then press the leg of the patient from the upper part of the thigh down to the ankle with a bandage, and then cut the vein at one place, or two, or three with a wide incision, and then elevate the black blood with the tieue ma from below the leg upwards until as much blood as you desire has come out, which is enough for the patient's constitution."
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	"And now seize that one, and order them to abstain from foods that generate black bile."
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	"And perform the cure by phlebotomy when the veins are full and it is necessary for the patient."
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	"The elevation of their limbs is as follows: you who raises the patient's leg if it is movable and brings it close to wash it with cold water until it reddens and veins are filled; or let them be exercised by strong exercise, if bath is not available until the limb is heated."
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	"And then seize the cord in the right side of the vein for section either at its beginning or end, or lower down near its root."
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	"And then open the cord with tweezers and strip the vein from all sides until it becomes apparent to the touch, and it is necessary for the one who seizes that rope to decline to blackness."
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	"And then remove the cord with the evacuator and you will seize that white which should be a thread."
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	"And then put that vein away so that it may rise up and be separated from the cord, and suspend it with tweezers or a hook."
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	"And then seize another section close to that section for three fingers, and then strip the cord from above the vein until it appears."
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	"And then elevate that vein and cut it in another section near its root, and then pull out that vein and elevate it until it passes through the second section, and then pull out that vein from the section that is above it."
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	"And do that until you pull out that vein from the section that is above all sections, so that it may all be pulled out; and then cut it."
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	"And if you cannot succeed in pulling out and elevating it, then insert a needle with fine thread doubled over and tie that vein and pull it out, or insert the vein and turn your hand all around until it may be grasped."
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	"And be careful that it is not cut; because if it is broken, it will be difficult to elevate the vein and it will bring about illness through that injury."
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And once that has all been pulled out, then pause over the place of the plugged wound submerged in wine and rose oil and non-rose oil, and cure it so that it may be healed."
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	"And if the vein is constricted and has any tortuosity at which it may be wrapped around its parts, and is not straight as we have said, then you must cut over that at all parts of the tortuosity of the vein and at the places where it may be wrapped around it, and then suspend it with tweezers so that you may elevate it all."
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	"And be careful with your section that you do not cut the vein and that you do not plug it up, because it will be difficult to elevate if you do so; and use your discretion in this matter."
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	"Form of the incident in which a vein is severed:"
Forma de unci orp:	"A hook shape:"
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	"It is not sharp like hooks and does not have a pointed tip so that it may not plug the vein; but rather it must be of thick flexibility, because if it were thin, it would cut the vein due to its thinness. There must be in it an excess thickness as we have said."
De extraccio venae cruris.	"Of the extraction of a vein from the leg:"
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	"This vein is generated in the cambas of the tail lands such as those found in Arabia and in the dry tail lands of India with little tenderness, where there is neither grass nor bush."
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	"And it is also generated in other parts of the body besides the tail."
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	"And its growth is due to putrefaction that comes from the spine, such as poison coming from within the body by means of snakes and worms and crabs and worms generated between the spine and the flesh."
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	"The sign of the onset of its occurrence is that this vein becomes inflamed in the tail, and it begins to swell up at that place, and then it starts to come out from the location of that swelling which resembles a root of a plant."
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	"And then when the tip of it appears, you must wrap around that tip a weight of lead which weighs one drachm between two drachms, and bind it up and leave the lead suspended from the tail."
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	"And whenever some cause makes it come out at other parts outside of it, wrap that up with lead and bind it up."
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	"And if it is prolonged, then you must cut off a part of it and wrap up the remainder; but do not cut that with a root-like edge because if you do so, it will be constricted and will go back into the flesh and will cause an aposteme and purulence in that place and bad ulceration."
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	"So that it may be gradually treated and extracted little by little, so that it all may come out from the end of it and nothing remains inside the body."
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	"And some men have said that this vein is as long as two cubits and ten digits, and I have heard of one which was twenty cubits."
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	"And if it is cut during the time of its treatment, then insert a probe into the track of it and pierce that with a long probe through the body so that all that is in the material may be evacuated, and apply putrefactive remedies to that place for some days; and also cure it by means of the treatment of apostemes."
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	"And this vein sometimes has many branches, especially when it appears at the joint of the foot or in the foot, and many openings come to it, and each opening has several branch veins."
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	"And therefore cure it as we have said in the division and with what is said above."
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	"Of cutting for worms generated under the skin, called bovine ailment:"
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	"This ailment is called in some lands 'bovine ailment' because often it happens to oxen and there is a worm which is born between the spine and the flesh, which goes throughout the body pushing and pulling, and it is felt as it moves from member to member until it breaks the spine and comes out."
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	"And its generation occurs due to putrefaction of some humors such as happens with worms, serpents, earthworms, and ascarids in the belly."
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	"And it is feared for its malice because when it goes through the body and rises up to the head, and arrives at the eye, then it breaks in there and enters and destroys the eye, which happens often."
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	"And therefore when you wish to cure that and extract it, then it must be done by following its movement and appearance as felt by the senses, and then you must press down on what is above it and on both sides of it with binding and constriction, and thus dry up over it and draw it out."
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	"And if it is embedded in the flesh and cannot be removed, then apply a cautery with fire to that place until it dies there, for the greatest cause of concern is corruption of it with which it corrupts that place as we have said."
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	"And if you wish to prevent it from reaching the head near the eye, then press down on the eyebrow with strong constriction and also dry up over it, and draw it out; and this patient must use means of purification for his body using medicines that evacuate bad putrid humors, and he should avoid foods that cause putrefaction."
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	"Of cutting for the ailment called 'nafir':"
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	"This illness is named in our land 'nafir', and it is pain that comes to certain limbs, which then changes from limb to limb."
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	"I have already seen what you recommended."
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	"I was called to see a sick woman in a village. I uncovered her arm and saw a small inflammation on the vein near the elbow. After an hour had passed, I saw that inflammation move slowly upwards towards the shoulder, but more lightly than being carried by force, as if it were liquid silver flowing from place to place."
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	"And then pain came to that place and remained in the muscle. And this lasted for about an hour."
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	"And also it ran into the other chest until it reached the other arm."
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	"And he/she also told me to turn around so that I could see it all over their body, as much as I had seen. And they were too amazed by the transformation of the inflammation and its speed from limb to limb."
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	"And I had already seen something like this before in my practice according to that manner, but I have rarely heard people say that pain is transferred from limb to limb."
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	"But I did not see that in the wounds as with the woman."
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	"And I do not think it was anything other than because the woman was elderly, with rough skin and visible veins, and in this appearance that windy change of sensation seemed apparent."
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	"And it is necessary that this retro-cure does not appear in those who are delicate and have humid bodies with hidden veins."
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	"And when you want the cure of this inflammation, and the patient feels that pain, then it is not apparent to your eye as we have said. Then strike upon that place with your hand lightly and repeatedly until that windy sensation has gone out completely, and cauterize the place."
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	"But if you do not see it with your eyes, then cure that with friction of the body and with what drives out windiness, and apply those pills made from stinking herbs and pills of serrapie and similar things."
De extraccio de sagetas.	"Arrow extraction."
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	"Arrows vary according to species and the body locations they target. Their diversity lies in having large, small, concave, blunt, or solid points. Some have three edges, others tongues, while still others are star-shaped."
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	"If the arrow hits limbs or organs such as the brain, heart, liver, lungs, kidneys, intestines, bladder, or similar parts, then depending on whether the patient shows signs of imminent death (which will be discussed later), it is appropriate to avoid removing that arrow in cases where death would likely result. However, if these signs are not apparent and the arrow is not deeply embedded within the limb, then it may be removed and the wound treated."
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	"If the arrow strikes the brain and pierces the skull, causing damage to the cerebrum above it, symptoms may include sudden violent headache, scotoma (partial loss of vision), vertigo (dizziness), ringing in the ears, inflammation and redness of the eyelids, confusion or mixture of thoughts, vomiting bile, difficulty speaking with possible loss of speech, and leakage of watery, whitish fluid resembling flour from the wound site, accompanied by excessive moisture similar to that of flesh."
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	"Therefore, if these symptoms are apparent, it is advisable to abstain from attempting to treat the wound or remove the arrow unless it is protruding outside."
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	"If the arrow strikes near the left nipple and is deeply embedded in hard tissue (not soft), with movement of the arrowhead resembling a heartbeat, accompanied by bleeding of dark blood from the wound site, coldness or numbness in the extremities, profuse sweating, paleness, and syncope (fainting), then know that death will soon ensue without delay."
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	"If the arrow wounds the lung, there will be frothy bloody sputum from the wound site, coughing or choking near the collar area, change in the patient's complexion, rapid breathing, shortness of breath, and urgent desire for cold air."
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	"If the arrow strikes the diaphragm (velum), located in the lower chest area, there will be pain near the lower ribs, and accompanied by rapid breathing with intense pain and sighing. All movements of the muscles of the limbs are weakened."
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	"If the arrow strikes the stomach, there will be vomiting of undigested food from the wound site."
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	"If the arrow strikes the abdomen and is embedded within it, there will be a visible wound or tear in the skin, tissue, or bowel which has been ruptured. There is little hope for recovery with such an injury, as extraction of the arrow would be futile."
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	"If the arrow strikes the bladder and urine is expelled from the wound site, or if there are other signs of injury to external parts nearby, accompanied by intense pain over the affected area, then know that this is a fatal injury."
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	"However, other areas such as the face, neck, throat, shoulders, arms, and joints of the backbone, collarbone, and sternum are considered safe provided that the arrow does not strike a vein or artery and is not poisonous."
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	"And I advise you to consider this information about arrows for your own use in treating such injuries."
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	"Why is it that when an arrow struck the tear duct of a man's eye during battle, I removed it from the other side near his ear and the wound healed without causing any damage to his eye?"
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	"And when I extracted another arrow that had struck a Jew in the socket of his eye, leaving the eyelid intact and then partially closing it, I could not find the arrowhead as it was already concealed. All that remained was a small extremity attached to his cheekbone, and it was a large, sharp Turkish arrow with a lion-shaped tip that had no barbs."
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	"And the Jew survived, without injury to his eye despite this serious wound."
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	"And I extracted another arrow from a Christian man who had been struck in the throat. It was an Arab arrow with barbs, and I cut into it between two guides and carefully removed it without causing further injury to the patient's throat, allowing him to recover."
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	"And I extracted another arrow from a man who had been struck in the abdomen and believed he would die from this wound. However, after thirty days with no change in his condition or signs of improvement, I made an incision over the arrow and carefully removed it, allowing him to recover without further injury."
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	"I once saw a man in whom an arrow had become embedded in his back. The wound became consolidated over time and remained there for about seventy years, until it eventually emerged near the sternum."
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	"I saw a woman in whom an arrow had become embedded in her abdomen. The wound became consolidated within her and did not change her physical condition in any way; she suffered no injury to her natural functions."
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	"I saw another man in whom an arrow had become lodged in his face and consolidated. The arrowhead broke off, causing him little pain, but leaving him with many scars like these."
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	"I extracted the arrow from the chief of the king's guards that had struck him in the middle of his nose and was already leaning slightly to the right. The entire arrow was concealed."
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	"And I was summoned to treat him shortly after he received the wound, just three days later."
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	"And so I first probed the wound from the arrow quite narrowly. Then I carefully felt around with my finger but could not detect anything. But he himself felt a pricking sensation just beyond his right ear, and I suspected that this was due to the tip of the arrow."
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	"I then widened the wound using an instrument with which I could attract and digest matter, believing that this would help me locate the arrowhead so that it could be extracted."
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	"But I did not cause any significant injury to the wound despite having reached the arrowhead. I continued using the instrument for many days without causing any further harm, and meanwhile the wound had healed over. Then one day he felt the arrow inside his nose and reminded me of this."
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	"Then I applied a strong caustic medicine to the wound for several days until it opened up again. With my finger, I felt around inside and discovered the tip of the arrow adhering to his cheekbone."
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	"Then I continued applying the strong medicine until the wound opened up enough for me to see the tip of the arrow clearly. This took approximately four months."
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	"Then, once the wound had healed enough for me to insert forceps and grasp it without causing any further harm, I continued trying various techniques of extraction using different types of forceps, as described later in this chapter. Finally, one day I managed to grasp it with forceps designed for downward extraction and pull it out. Then I restored the wound."
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	"Some physicians judged that the cartilage of his nose could not be restored, but I was able to restore it and the wound healed completely. He regained his health entirely without any further complications."
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	"I remind you of the method of extracting certain arrows because I will provide a rule and explanation for what I have not said, since the parts of this art and its definitions are not understood through narration nor those in the book."
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	"The wise artisan compares little about matter, and about what is present rather than what is absent; furthermore, he discovers new operations and new instruments as needed for the removal of foreign causes of the art when they occur."
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	"And therefore I say that arrows are not forced out of the limbs into which they are inserted, but rather by two methods: either by attraction of the place where it entered or by the contrary of the other part."
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	"And that which is thrown out by the place where it entered is either a procedure in a fleshy location, and is attracted and forced out."
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	"And if it does not obey the exit of the wound at that time, then you should leave it for a few days so that the flesh around it can heal, and thereby alleviate its attraction and exit."
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	"And similarly, if it is inserted into bone and does not obey the exit at that time, then you should leave it for a few days and repeat it with attraction and movement each day until it has been forced out."
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	"And if it does not obey the exit even after a few days, then you should pierce around the arrow in that bone with a fine awl so that the place is widened by the arrow, and then extract it."
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	"And if the arrow is inserted into the bone of the head and has already proceeded into one of the ventricles of the brain, and appears in the illness some of those accidents which I mentioned earlier, then refrain from extracting the arrow and leave it for a few days until its being is equalized; because if the arrow pierces the brain, death will not be prolonged."
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	"And if the arrow is only inserted into the body of the bone and does not pass into the brain, and the illness remains for a few days without any occurrence of those accidents, then you should use attraction of the arrow and attraction of that place."
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	"But if it is deeply inserted and does not obey extraction, then you should administer awls around the arrow as we have recommended, and then cure that place until it is healed."
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	"But if the arrow has already been swallowed in the place of the body and is obscured from sensation, then you should search for it with your hand, and if you feel it there, then attract it with some instruments which are convenient for attracting it."
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	"And if you cannot get hold of it due to the constriction of the pleura and the length of the spine, and there is neither bone nor nerve nor vein here, then incise upon the pleura until it is widened so that it will be possible to extract the arrow."
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	"And if it is in the ear which is being held, then deliver the flesh into which it has been inserted on all sides with all possible means; and manipulate that area until you achieve its evasion through fracture of the ear bones or torsion of those parts so that it will obey."
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	"And when you perform the extraction of the arrow in any place where it is, then use torsion of your hand and forceps on all sides until it makes that part obey; and act with great subtlety so that the arrow is not broken and so that it will be difficult to attract it and extract it."
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	"And if you cannot succeed with that at your time, then leave it for a few days until the parts around it can be mobilized, and then repeat that because it will now have been alleviated."
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	"But if you have trouble with the flow of blood, then administer what we said about treatment in its chapter."
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	"And preserve your skill in incising veins or nerves, and administer all possible means of the evasion of the arrow with facility, tranquility, slowness, and firmness as we have recommended."
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	"And once you have contracted the arrow, then perform traction according to the figure according to which the casing of the arrow was placed inside it, because this is more advantageous."
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	"But if that is not possible for you, then administer what is possible for you according to those figures."
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	"But those arrows which are fired backwards due to the contrary part of another part, or where some part has already proceeded from it into its outer parts, or where there is hardness in the extremity of the arrow due to sensation of the flesh above the spine and it becomes prominent; then cut upon that; and make the section according to the quantity which the forceps can grasp; and then attract it because it will be easy to extract."
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	"But if it is retained in the bone, then twist your hand contrary-wise until the arrow presses against the bone and widen that place, and then extract it."
