Then reduce that bandage over all fragments, and when you have reduced the compression of the fracture with compression downwards, this is what should be apparent to you.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And all of this is done so that the splint does not move over the broken bone. And you should check the dressing every day to see if the bandage has softened or if the splint has shifted, and if it has, then correct it and tighten the binding.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And then place the dressing over the bone and on both sides of it under the armpit at night so that with this elevation the assistant raises up the arm on that side, thereby elevating the fracture of the collarbone above its muscles. Or else you may bind the arm to the chest with a sling.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not remove the dressing until about twelve days have passed without any signs of infection or abscess having occurred in that place.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	And also renew the poultice if you see that its effect is diminished, and adjust it to fit the compression and restore it until it has been restored and the fracture of the collarbone has healed.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And in about twenty-eight days it becomes strong and comfortable. But sometimes in some people this takes less time than that.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	On the restoration of fractures of the shoulder
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The blade of the scapula is broken on its lateral side, and only its margins are broken.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And so when the blade of the scapula is broken and it is only known by touch, then according to the shape of the fracture prepare for its reduction and reduce it in every way that you can by ingenuity.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	And then place powdered flour with egg white and linen on it, and also place a folded cloth poultice. Then also place over that a thin board splint according to the size of the entire blade or slightly larger.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	But if on one side of the splint there is a concavity in some places on the blade, then fill that concavity with linen and also make the splint even.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And then bind it firmly above with a long bandage having downward compression and with firmness of the splint so that it does not shift from its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	Check the dressing every day. And whenever it becomes softened, change it and tighten it again and adjust the splint if it has shifted from its place.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	Keep the limb on its own side.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	The blade of the scapula is restored in twenty days or at most twenty-five.
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And so when this number is completed, then you should dissolve the dressing, and be sure that it is of those bones whose union is not delayed nor their healing slowed.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if you proceed from the site of the broken bone and place your hand on the shoulder blade, then incise there and drain it if necessary, and do as we have said regarding the fracture of the collarbone for treating an abscess if one should occur here.
Capitol .vii.	De restauracio de fractura de la clavicula.
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	"To treat a broken leg."
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	"The leg is sometimes fractured in the middle of it and this can happen even if the ends are only cracked or shattered."
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	"And when the middle of it is broken in accidents, it leans towards one side and causes pain, difficulty in breathing, coughing, fever, and vomiting blood. The fracture can be felt in the cavity of the bone and is not hidden to the touch."
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	"And in the treatment of it, the patient should be placed on their back and a cushion put between their thighs; then press gently upon the muscles of the leg and adjust the bones of the leg as well as possible, according to all methods that are appropriate and convenient, until the shape of the bone is restored."
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	"And then apply bandages and gauze or linen cloths soaked in saltwater or chalk water and similar things, carefully wrapping them around the broken bone so that it is not moved. And sometimes tie a splint on the back to maintain its roundness, and tighten this with proper binding. And observe the dressing at all times, tightening it when it becomes loose."
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	"And if it is necessary to remove the dressing due to corruption or pressure, pain, swelling, or an abscess occurring in that place, then gently remove and replace the dressing, and correct whatever has happened there with care using proper methods. And then reapply the splint, sometimes changing its position; and adjust the bindings until healing occurs."
Capitol .viii.	**Chapter VIII.**
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	"For the healing of the ribs when they are crushed."
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	"Know that fractures of the ribs do not occur except in large spaces where there is flesh on the back; and at their ends, near the cartilage, it rarely happens except for that reason."
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	"And its recognition is not hidden from feeling through inquiry with them."
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	"And the healing should be done as follows: align the fracture with the said servant according to the most possible manner, so that it may be healed according to what is necessary, and properly apply plaster and strengthen the broken bone with steel if necessary."
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	"And if the fracture of the ribs is declinant towards its ends within, then it often happens that there is sudden sharp pain and puncture, such as occurs in those who have suffered pleurisy, because the bone pierces the membrane. And it also happens with difficulty breathing, coughing, and vomiting much blood; and this is difficult to cure."
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	"And already the Ancients knew how to treat that with many remedies."
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	"Thus they say: Cover the patient with warm foods that generate heat and windiness, so that the belly may be inflated and extended, and the fracture pushed outward."
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	"However, we should avoid this because it could cause an easy boil to form, unless otherwise necessary. And if one were to occur, this would help alleviate it."
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	"They said some of them that it should be placed on windiness and open so that it may suck strongly; and this seems like reasoning, but however it is feared that the windiness may draw the superfluities to the place due to weakness."
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	"Some of them said: Cover the place with wool that has already been submerged in hot oil, and powders should be placed between the ribs until it is filled, so that the wrapping may fit well according to its roundness; and let the illness be treated with pleurisy cure of food and medicine."
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	"And if the illness causes violent constriction which is not endured, and the bone pierces the velament with a puncturing wound, then they fear about the illness. Therefore, one should cut over the place, uncover the broken rib, and immediately place upon it that instrument which preserves the ciaphac, the memory of which has been previously mentioned, and gently cut the bone and extract it."
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	"And also, if the wound is large, sew its two lips with stitches, and dress it with plasters until it heals."
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	"And if an abscess forms inside, then take some powder and mix it with rose oil and apply it to the place, and let the illness be treated with what is appropriate for the internal abscess."
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	"And he should be propped up on pillows so that he may sit while sleeping until he is healed."
Capitol .ix.	"Chapter Nine."
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	"Regarding the restoration of fractures of the spinal column in the back and neck."
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Sometimes it happens that fracture occurs in the bones of the neck, and sometimes it happens to their articulation, similarly with the vertebrae of the back.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And if this happens to someone and you want to know if it will heal or not, then examine whether sometimes his muscles are softened, stunned, and deadened so that they can neither move nor extend nor contract. And when you press them with your fingers or prick them with a needle and he does not feel any pain there, then you know that it has not healed. In such cases it is mortal.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	But if he can move those muscles and feels constriction with pressure or puncture there, then you know that the bone is saved and the illness will go away with treatment.
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	But if it seems that the vertebrae of the neck are similar to this case and you want to know if they will heal or not, then consider their position.
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	Then if you find that some of them are already softened, it happened as in this case. And especially when he lies on his back, he feels ventilation and expulsion without his will, and sometimes he is raised up on his back and wants to urinate but cannot. Then you know that it is mortal, and at that point do not bother with its treatment.
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	"But if none of those occurs, the cause is better and more lightweight."
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	"The treatment for it is that you apply sedation to the abscess that has formed over the inflamed and infected area with some cotton soaked in hot water; place it there several times a day until the abscess is sedated."
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	"And then apply one of the comforting and stimulating plasters, and press it onto that area with a bandage. Command the patient to rest and remain calm, and not sleep on the side where they feel pain until they are healed."
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	"And if the inflammation of the bone sets in or some other cause that has already separated from it occurs, then you must cut into the flesh and remove that bone. Then join the two lips of the wound together with stitches if it is large; and then treat it with a poultice made from honey, until it heals."
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	"But if the head of the bone is broken off and it is the end of the cure, then you must insert your left thumb into the anus and grasp the broken bone with your other hand according to what is possible by means of a traction device. Then apply a poultice or plaster and bandage it."
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	"And if you feel broken fragments within it, then you must open that up and remove them, and treat the wound with the appropriate cure until it is healed."
Capitol .x.	Chapter X
De restauracio de la ancha.	Of restoration of the ankle.
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	The bones of the ankles are sometimes broken and when they are, their fractures are only contusions at their extremities and they incline toward the inside. And it happens that the patient feels pain in that place and puncturing, and the foot becomes stiff when it is fractured.
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	And the restoration of it is that you should stretch your hand over it until it is above the fracture as shown in the figure.
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	And if the fracture is only at its extremity, then you should grasp it according to what appears appropriate for traction until it is brought together in its natural shape.
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	But if the fracture is in the long bone or one that already inclines towards the inside of the foot, then you should have the patient lie on his/her stomach until you are prepared to perform the reduction of that fracture.
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	And then when you have grasped it, apply a plaster and also apply splints of wood or bone, and bind them tightly without fear of puncturing the fracture or displacing the splints.
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	And then fill in the concave part with whatever is at hand so that it takes up the pressure equally and commands the patient to sleep on their back or side.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	But if an inflammatory swelling occurs, then you should cease the extension and reduction of it until the inflammation has subsided, and apply whatever is appropriate to subdue that inflammation. And then return to the reduction of it and bind it as is necessary.
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	And if fragments or splinters occur in the bone, then you should remove them
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	Of restoration of fracture of the clavicle
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	The clavicle is that which is between the chest and the head of the shoulder
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	And if it is broken, then its restoration is by one of two methods, the first of which is that you should take a flat piece of wood of moderate thickness in this way:
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	And let there be attached at both ends two cords and then it shall be suspended from an elevated place
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	And then have the patient sit on a chair and then place their broken arm over the wood so that it reaches to its tip in the middle part where the curvature of the wood is attached
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	And then suspend some heavy weight from it, or have the patient extend it towards the left side and then the physician should hold both of its ends together so that the fracture returns to its proper position
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	The other method is that the patient should be propped up on their neck and have their collarbone suspended by a cord. And then command two assistants to hold it, one above the fracture with both hands and the other below it, and each of them should extend towards his side
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	And if you wish for the extension to be stronger, then bind it with one cord above the fracture and another below it, and each of the assistants should extend towards their respective sides
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	Therefore if the fracture is near the extremity of the muscle, then half of the cord should be placed on the tip and the other half below the fracture towards the chest
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	Similarly if the fracture is close to the chest, then the cord should be placed on that location and also on the chest
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	Grasp it gently and without struggle and then when it has been grasped as is necessary and applied properly, then bind it if inflammation does not occur
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	But if inflammation occurs, then leave the splint on for seven days and apply to it a compress of flaxseed boiled in vinegar and rose oil until the inflammation has subsided, and then bind it
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	And the method of binding it is that you should place plaster on the fracture and then place a wrapping of moist cloth over the plaster and then adjust the arm over that clavicle and place its covered hand on its own muscle
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	And then wrap the cloth around it and bind the arm over the clavicle so that the arm is in its proper position, unless some cause prevents it from doing so due to the broken bone
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	And then apply splints.
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	And then place on the fracture that splint which is broader and stronger than the others and insert between each splint the width of a finger and let the length of the splints be according to the fracture with an addition of three fingers on either side
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	And then bind over the splints with the splint which was mentioned at the beginning of this chapter
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	And ensure that your binding over the fracture is as tight as possible
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	And when the fracture has healed, then the binding should be looser
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	Therefore if you find yourself in the situation of having applied splints and binding as we have said at the time when you are restoring the limb to its proper position, then do so
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you fear inflammation, then leave the binding and splints on for seven days as we have said
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	And then consider the cord in all parts for three days so that it does not cause pressure or inflammation there, or so that food is prevented from reaching the limb due to excess tightness of the binding, and therefore correct everything as we have said
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	But if you suspect that nothing will happen due to your carelessness, then do not loosen the bandage but rather wait for three days or more
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	And let the patient sleep on their back with their hands on their stomach.
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	And place a bolster full of wool on the clavicle and ensure at all times during the night or day that neither the figure of the broken limb is disturbed nor that the cord becomes softened, so that you may correct everything with your skill
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.	And provide food for the patient according to the order which we have mentioned earlier, so that the food is soft at first until binding begins and then gradually make it thicker.
Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	As for the custom of the splints and bandages, they should be bound for forty days. Then they should be loosened and a bath given and medicinal ointments applied which can correct them
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	And if the fracture has been properly healed, then do not remove the binding and splints until after ten days or two months
Capitol .xii.	"Chapter Twelve."
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	"On the restoration of a broken arm."
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	"The arm is composed of two bones called the two forks; one of which is small and is that which holds the aforementioned fist, while the other is large and is placed next to it on the side facing downwards."
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	"And sometimes only the larger fork bone breaks, or only the smaller one; but rarely do they break together."
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	"When the little fork bone breaks at the top, its restoration and healing will be easier."
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	"But when it breaks below the fracture, its restoration is difficult and its healing takes a long time."
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	"And even worse than that is when two bones break together."
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	"Therefore if the bone that is broken is the small fork above, then it is advisable for the doctor to perform a simple reduction with ease before it heals."
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	"But if the large fork is what has broken, then traction must be applied forcefully."
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	"And if both forks are broken together, then you should apply traction even harder."
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	"And you should place the figure of the hand in its proper position during reduction and traction by extending it on a pillow; placing the thumb above all other fingers, the little finger lower than the others, and the patient lying on their side facing upwards."
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	"And place a pillow in front of them at the level or behind the elbow to prevent him from moving around."
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	"Now have one assistant extend the elbow below with their own hand or with linen, and another assistant extend it above in the same manner."
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	"And now let the surgeon reduce the bone into place by aligning it according to its best possible position."
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	"If there are any irregularities in the fracture of the bone, then you should press all your weight on it to reduce it back into place."
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	"But if there is separation of the bone ends with displacement of the elbow joint that does not reduce spontaneously, then you should proceed as follows:..."
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	"But if the fracture is compounded (open), I have already discussed this case separately. Therefore, take care of that."
E si accideys apostema caut al comensament de la tua restauracio, lahoras tu lineys un drap am cerot fayt de oli rozat e cera blanca, e sia migier entre specitut e subtilitat, e strenh drap sobre aquel am strictura subtil entro que le apostema sia cedat; e lahoras remau le cerot e pausa emplastre preparat de polvera de moli am clayre de huou, e aprop pausa stelhas; e sia la stela la qual es pauzada sobre aquela fractura pus lada e pus fort.	"And if you encounter an aposteme at the beginning of your reduction, then take a cloth smeared with cerot made from rose oil and white wax, which should be neither too thick nor too thin. Place this cloth over the aposteme with subtle tension until it subsides. Then remove the cerot and apply a plaster prepared with powdered mallow mixed with egg whites, and also apply plaster strips; make sure that the plaster strip placed on the fracture is wide and strong."
E sapias que·l nombre de las stelas del bras so vi en las majors disposicios, o sia la fractura en un focil o en dos focils ensemps.	"And know that in the case of fractures of the arm, there are usually six plaster strips applied, either for a fracture of one fork or for two forks together."
E aprop pausa la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura pus fort e pus vehement, e quan mays sira la extrictura a las partidas desus de la fractura o a las partidas pus bassas de lu, pausa la strictura un pauc pus molh segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu en le comensament del capitol.	"Now apply your traction even harder and more vehemently over the fracture site, and if necessary, increase the tension even further on the proximal or distal parts of the fracture according to what is described at the beginning of this chapter."
E les draps que so envolopatz sobre la fractura sian draps mols humitz, e no sian durs ni aspres, e·l fiel am le qual es strenhut sia de li propriament migier entre subtil e gros, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	"And the cloths wrapped around the fracture should be soft and moistened with water, not hard or rough. The bandage used for tension should be of moderate thickness between subtle and thick, as recommended earlier."
E considera le membre e·l liament aprop alcus dias.	"Keep the limb immobilized for several days."
E si accideys alcuna causa de la qual rectificacio es necessaria, ayssi cum prusiment le qual accideys al membre, e lahoras cove que tu enbroques le membre am aygua cauda entro que cesse aquel pruziment.	"And if there is any cause that requires repositioning, such as swelling of the limb, then you should immerse the limb in warm water until the swelling subsides."
E leysses le membre no costreyt entro que repause, e aprop torna la strictura.	"Leave the limb at rest without traction for a few days and then reapply the traction."
E si la extrictura ja es mollificada e l’os ja es remaugut e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras rectifiqua tot aquo am la tua vertut.	"And if the traction has been sufficiently maintained and the bone has already reduced well, then you should now finish everything with your own strength."
E considera mays si le nutriment es prohibit pervenir al membre per superfluitat de strictura, quar lahoras cove que mollifiques aquel un petit e laysses aquel per alcus dias entro que corra ad aquel le nutriment, e aprop strenh aquel.	"And if there is any obstruction of nourishment to the limb due to excessive traction, then you should relax it a little and leave it alone for a few days until circulation is restored, and then apply traction again."
Mays si al malaute no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no cove que sia desliat entro aprop xx dias o enviro de aquels.	"But if the limb shows no signs of any of the conditions mentioned earlier, then there is no need to remove the traction for more than about 20 days or so."
E aprop sia suspenduda la ma del malaute per la sua vertut de movement agitatius, e fay aquel dormir sobre le sieu dos.	"Then have the patient use his own strength to move his arm around and make him lie on his back to sleep."
E sapias que aquesta fractura es restaurada en xxx dias o en xxxii dias, o fort leu es restaurada en xxviii dias, e tot aquo es segon la disposicio de las compleccios e las disposicios de la vertut.	"And know that this fracture is usually restored in 30 to 32 days, but sometimes it can be restored in as few as 28 days, depending on the condition of the complexion and the strength of the patient."
Capitol .xiii.	"Chapter XIII."
De restauracio de fractura de la pinche de la ma e dels ditz.	"On the reduction of fractures of the thumb and fingers."
Sapias que a la pinche de la ma e als nuzes dels ditz tart endeve fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio motas veguadas.	"Know that at the tip of the hand and in the joints of the fingers there are often fractures, not actual breaks but frequent dislocations."
E quan accideys a la ma fractura o atrissio, lahoras cove que·l malaute segua cayrat e denant lu lies cezent segon equalitat, e aprop pausa la ma de lu sobre aquela extenduda.	"And when there is fracture or dislocation of the hand, the patient should be made to lie on their back with their arms extended out in front of them, and place their other hand over that one to keep it steady."
E aprop le ministre extenda les osses trencatz e·l metge engualhe aquels entro que sian congongitz am bona congoncio.	"Then the servant should extend the broken bones and the physician will align them, making sure they fit together well with proper alignment."
E lahoras cove que pause emplastre e estopa, si no accideys apostema caut; e aprop pausa stela desus segon la quantitat del loc, e tu ja has envolopada aquela en drap de li.	"And then a plaster and bandage should be applied, unless there is already a wound that needs cauterizing. Afterwards, apply a splint according to the size of the location, and you have already wrapped it in linen."
Mays si la trincadura es en las partidas dedintz deves le ventre de la palma, e lahoras fay semblant de spera de drap, e comanda al malaute que strenha aquela am la sua palma trincada; aprop sia strenguda am drap lonc.	"But if the fracture is on the palm side of the hand, then make a sling from cloth and tell the patient to hold it with their palm pressed against theirs. Afterwards, bind it securely with a long piece of cloth."
E sia la stelha de cuer am drap en le qual sia levitat, per so que le cuer sia aplicat a la palma; e strenh aquela segon que cove.	"And the splint should be made of leather wrapped in cloth that is elevated on one side so that the leather touches the palm. Then bind it securely as needed."
Mays si la fractura es a las partidas defora, lahoras cove que pauses desus stela e autre estela de la partida dejos en la palma, per so que la ma sia uberta e dreyta; e aprop pausa la strictura, ayssi cum es revolvuda la ma a la rateta entre les ditz am liamentz.	"But if the fracture is on the outer side of the hand, then apply a splint on top and another splint from the edge of the palm to the wrist so that the hand is upright and straight. Then apply the bandage in this way, as if the hand were turned towards the little finger between those parts."
E si accideys fractura a alcu dels nozes dels ditz, lahoras si es le dit pous, sia engualat segon que cove e aprop sia strenhut am la palma e si·t voles, pausa a lu astela petita dreyta per so que sia elevada la fractura e no sia mauguda.	"And if there is a fracture in one of the knuckles of those parts, then if it's the thumb, align it as needed and bind it to the palm. And if you wish, apply a small splint on the outside to elevate the fracture and prevent movement."
Mays si la fractura es en les autres ditz, ayssi cum en aquel del mieg loc, o en le indic, o en le auricular, o en le anular, lahoras sia engualhat e liat am le dit sa le qual siec aquel; o sian totz liatz segon continuacio, e es milhor; o pausa sobre aquel stela petita, ayssi cum havem dit en le pous.	"But if the fracture is in one of the other knuckles, such as at the middle joint or the index finger, ring finger, or little finger, then align and bind it with the finger on which it occurs. Or they can all be bound together continuously, which is better; or apply a small splint over that area, as we have said for the thumb."
E considera, en la tua restauracio, e aprop aquela, la disposicio de apostema caut e oppose — am la tieua operacio — am aquo que cove quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, segon que es iterada la narracio de lu.	"And when you are performing your restoration and bandaging, consider the location of the wound, cauterization, and opposition according to what is needed in case any cause occurs that has been mentioned previously."
Capitol .xiv.	"Chapter XIV."
De restauracio de fractura del os de la coyssa.	"On the restoration of fractures of the bone of the ankle."
Le os de la cueyssa motas veguadas es trencat e es declarat al sentiment segon que es convertit a la partida denant e a la pus sobirana.	"The bone of the ankle is often broken and declares itself by becoming displaced at the joint in front and being pushed upwards."
E la restauracio de lu se fa enayssi que·l liament es strenhut sobre la fractura e autre liament dejos la fractura, e le malaute sia prostrat sobre le sieu ventre e sobre la cara.	"And the restoration is done in such a way that a bandage is applied above the fracture and another below it. The patient should be lying on their stomach with their face down."
E aprop le ministre extenda tot le liament a la sua partida segon la qualitat, quan la fractura es en le mieg loc del os.	"And the minister should extend all the bandages to his party according to the quality when the fracture is in the middle of the bone."
Mays si es propdana a la razitz de la cueyssa, lahoras sia le liament propda al denolh a la partida del pentenilh, per so que la extencio caja en sus, e le autre liament dejos la fractura.	"If the fracture is at the root of the thigh bone, then draw the thread tightly to its edge near the knee joint, so that the tension comes out from there, and let another thread remain on the break."
E semblantment si la trencadura es propdana al denolh, lahoras sia fayt le liament propda al denol, e sia la extencio a las partidas dejos.	"If the fracture is at the knee joint, then draw the thread tightly to the knee, and let the tension come out from there."
E aprop le metge enguale le os am amduas las sieuas mas entro que reduzesca aquel segon la semblansa natural e l’os es conjungit per bona conjunccio; lahoras cove que pauses emplastre e strictura, si no accideys al membre apostema.	"And then the doctor presses both bones together at the two ends so that they reduce it back to its natural shape and the bone is joined together by good union. Then you must apply a plaster and strapping if there is no inflammation of the member."
Mays si accideys en lu apostema, lahoras tu layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que l’apostema caut sia cedat, e aprop retorna a la tua curacio.	"But if there is an abscess, then leave it alone for several days until the abscess has softened, and then return to your treatment."
La strictura de lu sia ayssi fayta: cove que envolopes sobre la fractura una benda dura, e dobla aquela dos o tres veguadas, e remaugua de lu superfluitat; e aprop envolopa la camba entro que pervengua al talo e a la razitz de la cueyssa.	"The strapping should be done like this: you must wrap a hard bandage over the fracture two or three times and remove any excess; then wrap the limb so that it reaches to the ankle and root of the thigh."
E intromet lonc fiel entre la cueyssa e la camba prop del denol a las partidas dejos, e venguan las extremitatz del fiel de la partida pus sobirana de las doas partz, e aprop revolveys sobre la camba e la cueyssa aquo que superflueys de la benda.	"And insert a long needle between the thigh and the bandage near the knee joint, bringing the ends of the thread from above on both sides, then wrap it around the limb."
E aprop pausa sobre la cueyssa en le loc de aquela fractura astelhas, e pausa de aquelas una stela sobre le os de la camba.	"And then press a pad over the thigh at that fracture point, and attach a splint to the outer surface of the bandage."
E aprop uempli las vacuitatz entre la camba e la cuoyssa am draps mols, per so que sia coagulada la extrictura.	"And then fill in the spaces between the limb and the thigh with soft cloths so that the strapping remains firm."
E aprop comensa am strictura fort del mieg sobre le loc de la fractura am tres envolucios o quatre, e quant mays tu te alonhas am liament del loc de la fractura, la tua strictura sia menor e pus leugiera e pus molha.	"And then begin with a tight strapping of the middle over the fracture point using three or four wraps, and as you move away from the fracture point, make your strapping looser and softer."
E aprop exten a doas extremitatz del fiel a las partidas dejos entro que pervengua a la cavilha del pe, e strenh amdoas las extremitatz de las stelhas del autra part per so que·l liament no sia remaugut del sieu loc.	"And then extend both ends of the thread to the sides until they reach the heel of the foot, and tighten both ends of the splint on the other side so that the limb does not move from its position."
E aprop leyssa la strectura sobre aquel, don esta ayssi que no accideys al membre corrosio ni apostema caut ni emflacio e semblantz ad aquels; e si accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, adonc cueta te am desliament de lu, e rectifica aquo que accideys tot aprop, segon que havem dit motas veguadas.	"And then leave the strapping on for several days without causing any injury to the limb or abscesses or inflammation or swelling resembling those described earlier. If anything happens, remove the strapping immediately and correct it as soon as possible, according to what we have said many times."
Mays si en le os es pessa del os la qual pongua, lahoras cove que tu engualhes aquel segon que a tu es possibla; e sino, fen sobre lu e remau aquel, e cura am aquo del qual es precedida la rememoracio entro que sia sanat.	"But if the bone sticks out from its proper place, you must reduce it back into position as much as possible. If this cannot be done, then apply a splint and remove it once healing has occurred."
E alcunas veguadas es strenhuda aquesta fractura de la coyssa otra aquo que sian ajustadas a lu stelhas, ayssi cum havem dit en le adjutori e·n le bras.	"And sometimes this fracture of the thigh is strengthened with splints other than those that have been mentioned in the treatise and in the arm."
Mays empero en la restauracio de lu en tal manieyra fayta no accideys al malaute claudicacio; e si es restaurada sola, otra aquo que li sia applicada l’autra camba, lahoras es necessari que claudique aquel del qual es tostemps.	"But nevertheless, in restoring the limb in this manner there should be no limpiness caused by shortening. And if it is restored alone, without the other leg being applied, then necessarily that limb will remain lame."
E sapias que la coyssa es strenhuda en xl dias o un pauc mes o un pauc mens, e tot aquo es segon la diversitat de las compleccios e de las autras dispozicios.	"And know that the thigh is strengthened in forty days or a little more or less, and all this depends on the diversity of complexions and other dispositions."
Capitol .xv.	"Chapter Fifteen"
De restauracio de la fractura de la rodela del denolh.	"On the reduction of fractures of the collarbone."
Sapias que fractura de la rodela del denol tart endeve, mays accideys a lu motas veguadas atrissio.	"You should know that fracture of the kneecap can occur suddenly, but it often happens due to direct impact."
Mays si accideys a lu fractura, lahoras no es sino fissura o trauc en las suas partidas, e aquo es am plagua o ses plagua, e sobre aquo tot es estat am le sentiment.	"And if there is fracture, it is only a split or crack in its parts, and this is an illness or small injury, and overall it has been felt as such."
E la restauracio de lu es enayssi que sia engualat aquo que es romput de las partidas de lu am les ditz entro que sia agreguat e conjongit segon que es possible per equacio e facilitat e fabricacio.	"And the repair of it is easy, so that what has been broken in its parts should be united again with these sutures that have been added and joined together as much as possible for equanimity and ease of formation."
E aprop pausa emplastre e pausa sobre aquel stela redonda, si indigeysses de aquela; e strenh desus am strictura ad aquo convenient.	"And therefore pause with plaster and pausing over that round surface, if you need to do so; and stretch over it with this binding accordingly."
E aprop considera totas las disposicios las quals havem recomtadas en las autras fracturas, ayssi cum es apostema caut e semblant ad aquels enaissi que se oppause a tot accident am aquo que a lu es convenient entro que sia sanat.	"And also consider all the dispositions that we have recommended for other fractures, thus like cauterization and similar applications as much as possible so that it pauses on all accidents with whatever is convenient for its healing."
Capitol .xvi.	"Chapter XVI"
De restauracio de la fractura de la camba.	"On the repair of fracture of the knee-cap."
Sapias que en la camba so dos osses dels quals la un es gros, e es le nompnat per nom de la camba; e l’autra es subtil, e es nompnat focil.	"You should know that in the kneecap there are two bones, of which one is thick and is called by the name of the kneecap; and the other is thin, and is called patella."
E accideys a quascus de las specias de fractura aquo que accideys als dos osses del bras, e per aquo es fayta restauracio de lu ayssi cum restauracio del bras engualment, e la operacio de lu es una.	"And it happens with some species of fracture that it occurs to the two bones of the arm, and therefore its repair is made in the same way as the repair of the arm is made, and the operation for it is one."
E si so trincatz dos osses ensemps, la camba es convertida a totas partidas.	"And if both bones are broken at once, the kneecap becomes completely fragmented."
E si es trinquat le os pus subtil, la camba es convertida a las partidas Denant.	"If it is broken, the bone becomes twisted at its ends."
E si es trincat le os pus gros, atrobas aquel dejos, e es de aquelas causas que no so a tu ameguadas.	"And if it is crushed but not displaced, then those are cases which are not serious."
E aprop aministra extencio e equacio e liguacio de las astelas segon aquel engualment.	"And especially apply extension, traction and splinting of the bones according to that method."
Mays empero cove, si la fractura de la camba es laja havent motas satagias, que la extencio sia mendre e pus leugiera, e alleuja am la tua vertut.	"But consider this, if the fracture of the thigh bone is not accompanied by many complications, then the extension should be lighter and gentler, according to your strength."
E en la camba es alcuna causa de operacio sobre le bras, e es quan tu engualas las stelhas e que comples tota la tieua operacio, lahoras tu prendras pessas de fustz de pi le qual es pausat dejos las cauzas las quals so pausades en solies, e so faytas eyssament de brancas de palma; aligeys de aquelas a las quals es petita groceza, e no sia ges de las manudas, e sia la longuesa de aquelas segon la longuesa de la camba, e del denol entro al pus dejos.	"And when operating on the thigh bone, after you have straightened the bones and completed your operation, then you will take pieces of wood from a tree, which is placed near those causes that are placed in usual positions, and these are made equally from branches of palm; choose those that are light, not too heavy or large, and their length should be equal to the length of the thigh bone, from the knee to the hip."
E aprop envolopa sobre quascuna drap en doas envolucios segon la longitut de lu, e pausa la una sobre la partida de la camba de la una part e l’autra del autra part, e sian del denol entro al pus bas loc del pe.	"And then wrap each piece of wood in two layers according to its length, and place one on the upper thigh at one end and the other on the other end, and they should be placed from ten inches below the hip joint downwards."
E aprop lias las doas stelhas en tres locs de doas extremitatz e al mieg loc, quar am aquesta strectura la camba es prohibida de clinar a la partida dextra e sinistra, e sta per bona stacio.	"And then tie the two splints in three places at both extremities and at the middle point, because with this structure the thigh bone is prevented from bending to the right or left side, and it stands for good position."
E ja es aministrat un brasset de fust segon la longuesa de la camba; e sia pausada en lu la camba per so que conserve aquel de movement.	"And now you will administer a splint of wood according to the length of the thigh bone, and place it on it so that it may preserve its position."
E majorment cove que tu fassas aquo en fractura, e quan am aquela es plagua propriament.	"And especially this should be done in fracture cases, and when such an injury occurs properly."
E aprop considera en quascun jorn la camba e studia am aquel per derier studi, e tu le guardes de apostema e de imflacio o de autres causas semblantz; e cum accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, lahoras opausa te a lu am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	"And then examine the thigh bone every day and study it carefully to see if there is any inflammation or swelling or other similar causes. And whenever such cause occurs, you should apply that which is necessary according to the condition for its healing."
Capitol .xvii.	"Chapter XVII."
De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	Of the fracture of the ankle bone and bones of the foot.
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio.	Not the ankle bone alone suffers fracture all the time; but some bones of the foot suffer fracture occasionally; and those of the foot seldom suffer fracture, and do not suffer it unless they are out of their usual position.
E si als osses del pe endeve fractura e vezes aquels osses esser elevatz sobre si entre lor, lahoras le malaute pause le sieu pe sobre la terra preparat ayssi cum anant.	And if the bones of the foot suffer fracture and those bones are sometimes elevated above one another among themselves, then the patient places his foot on the ground prepared thus, as going.
E aprop pausa la un pe sobre aquo que es elevat de aquels osses, e aprop calca aquels, e prem, e engualha aquels entro que torno en los locs.	And near upon this he places one foot upon that which is elevated by those bones; and near upon it presses them down and squeezes them round about in the places.
E aprop pausa emplastre e stopa desus, e pausa dejos le ventre del pe una petita taula a la qual sian dos caps plas.	And near upon this he applies plaster and stops up above; and places on the front of the foot a small table with two flat heads.
E aprop strenh aquela am le pe am strectura descent, pus que tu has envolopada aquela am draps e am autres causes de las quals indigeys.	And near upon this he stretches that limb downwards with the foot; because thou hast enveloped it with cloths and other things of which thou standest in need.
E cum a lu passan tres dias o quatre, lahoras tu deslia le liament, quar tu atrobaras les osses engualatz, o sian trincatz o sian dislocatz, e la operacio en aquels es ayssi co coneysses.	And when three or four days have passed thou shalt then unbind it; for thou wilt find the bones squeezed together, either broken or disjointed; and the operation on these is as follows.
Mays si alcus ditz son trincatz, lahoras restaura aquels, e enguala aquels ayssi cum yeu e recomtat a tu en la restauracio dels ditz de la ma.	But if some of them are broken, then restore these; and squeeze them together thus with glue and sew as thou hast been taught in the restoration of those of the hand.
E aprop pausa al dit trincat stela segon la longitut del dit, e sia pus lada de lu un pauc; e aprop dejos le pe aquesta taula la qual e a tu recomtada, e strenh aquela am strictura decent.	And near upon this place the splint along the length of the toe and let it be thus made somewhat wider at the end; and near upon this place on the foot that table which hath been recommended to thee, and stretch that with a downward strain.
Mays si aquo que es trincat dels osses so dos o tres o mays, lahoras tu pausa sobre quascun dit astela de la sua quantitat envolopada en drap leon, e strenh la taula en le pus bas del pe, e sia stant sobre la un dels caps de la taula foro le ventre del pe per que la tengua am bona retencio.	But if that which is broken of the bones are two or three or more, then place over each toe a splint according to its quantity wrapped in lion's skin; and stretch the table on the lower part of the foot and let it stand upon one of the flat heads at the front of the foot so that it may have good retention.
E es convenient a tu que no oblides que no consideres totas las causas las quals que e ditas a tu en las autras fracturas dels accidentz que havem dit; e opausa te a tot accident am aquo que cove.	And it is necessary for thee that thou dost not forget to consider all those causes which are mentioned to thee in the other fractures of accidents that have been spoken of; and apply thyself to each accident with what is appropriate.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII
De fractura del conh de la femna e del os del pentenilh e de la vergua del home.	Of the fracture of the thigh bone of a woman, of the bone of the hip joint and of the penis.
Quan le conh de la femna es trincat, lahoras fay aquela ceser en cezela cayrada, e aprop enclina aquela a la partida del dos un petit, e sia tenguda detras.	When the thigh bone of a woman is broken, then make that cease in this manner, and near upon this incline it somewhat at the joint of the two legs behind.
E aprop la matrona umpla le conh de coto, e sia fayt en le conh de lu ayssi cum spera; e aprop la femna sia concutida, e eleva le dos de lu petit a petit, quar tot aquo es fora-getat entro que sia denant la partida del conh ayssi cum spera e l’os trincat retorna.	And near upon this the midwife shall bind it with soft cloth and let it be made firm in the thigh thus as an egg; and near upon this let the woman lie on her back and elevate little by little one buttock; for all this is done until that is before the joint of the thigh thus as an egg, and the broken bone returns.
E aprop pausa pulvils sobre le dos de lu, e quan vol urinar remaugua le coto am facilitat e aprop urine, e reduzeys e retorna aquel segon la manieyra segon la qual mezist aquel al comensament, e aprop retorne al sieu pulvil primier.	And near upon this apply poultices to the buttock; and when she wishes to urinate remove the bandage with ease and let her urinate; and reduce it again and return it according to the manner in which thou hast first placed it on; and then return to the first poultice.
E fassa ayssi per vii dias o enviro aquels, quar aquel es restaurat.	And do thus for seven days or thereabouts, for that is restored.
E si voles, pren una vezica de ovela e strenh sobre le trauc de lu una canula de canavera; e entromet tota la vesica en le conh de lu, e aprop ensuffla en la canula am vertut entro que la vesica sia imflada dedintz le conh, quar la fractura retorna.	And if thou wilt, take once a sheep's bladder and stretch it over the breach of that one with a reed cane; and put all the bladder into the thigh bone and then blow into the reed with breath until the bladder be inflated within the thigh bone, for the fracture returns.
E aprop sia umplida de coto e estia per alcus dias segon que havem recomtat, entro que sia sanat.	And near upon this let it be bound up with soft cloth and rest thus for some days according to that which hath been recommended until it be healed.
E quan le os del pentenil de home o de femna es trincat, lahoras aministra en la restauracio e agulacio de lu aquo que havem recomtat en l’os del anca.	And when the bone of the hip joint of a man or woman is broken, then administer to the restoration and reduction of it that which hath been recommended in the bone of the hip.
E aquo que es dreyt no es occultat en aquestas fracturas proprinquas e que pauc endeveno, majorment ad aquel al qual es alcun studi e us e enten aquest meu libre mot; quar aquela fractura significa a tu en las majors disposicios via dreyturiera en la restauracio e en la strictura de lu, e donc enten be.	And that which is right is not concealed in these fractures near to the body and easily done, especially to him to whom this my book is some study and use; for that fracture signifieth to thee in the greater dispositions a straight way rightly in the restoration and the strapping of it, and therefore thou shalt understand well.
Mays en la vergua del home quan es trincada, pren guarguamela de auca, e met la vergua en aquela; e aprop pausa sobre lu envolucio de drap, e sia envolopada, e aprop sia layssada per tres dias o enviro aquels, e sia sanada.	But in the penis of a man when it is broken, take a goose feather and put the penis into that; and near upon this apply over it wrapping of cloth and let it be wrapped up, and then let it lie for three days or thereabouts, and it shall be healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX
De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	"For the healing of bone fractures when they are inflamed."
Convenient es ad aquel al qual accideys fractura am plagua, e majorment si le os es gran ayssi cum es le os de la cuoyssa o de l’adjutori, o semblant ad aquel, que tu te cuoytes e fleubotomes aquel tantost si las condicios de fleubotomia a tu o testifican ayssi cum desus havem dit.	"It is convenient for that person who has suffered a fracture with inflammation, and especially if the bone is large like those of the thigh or arm, or similar. Therefore, you should immediately flebotomize that person if conditions for bloodletting are suitable as mentioned above."
E si la plagua eflueys sanc, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la retencio de lu enayssi que tu polverizes sobre lu zegi trissat, si a tu autra causa no es present.	"If the inflammation flows with blood, then you should cover it immediately and powder it with this mixture:..."
E aprop comensa restaurar la fractura en aquel meteys dia, e no prolongues aquo, si no accideys apostema.	"And thus begins to restore the fracture on that same day, without delay, unless there is an abscess."
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la restauracio de lu entro al ix dia, entro que sia cedat le apostema, e no apropinques a lu en le tertz dia e·l iiii de tot, quar tu faras accidir mals accidentz.	"But if an abscess occurs, you should leave the restoration for 9 days until it has healed. And do not approach it on the third day or fourth day altogether, because bad accidents may occur."
Mays si le os trencat es eminent sobre la codena descubert, lahoras cove que te perforses reduzir aquel e engualar aquel am las tuas mas am facilitat e am pauca extencio.	"But if the broken bone is prominent above the skin and exposed, you should carefully reduce it and align it with your hands using gentle force without excessive tension."
Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.	"But if the reduction is not well prepared and equaling it with your hands alone causes excessive tension, then you should use this instrument to reduce it: it is made of iron, seven or eight digits long and its width according to the amount of inflammation. And so it is necessary for the physician to have three or four of these instruments ready at hand for all kinds of fractures."
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	"And once it is reduced and properly aligned, apply a small amount of pressure so that it is not doubled during the operation."
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	"And if there are sharp edges at the ends of the bone fragments, you should carefully remove them with the forceps and reduce the size of the fragments as much as possible."
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And this is how it looks:"
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	"It is called in Greek 'labre volentz atelarem', meaning it is a rare case."
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	"For what reason must the extremity of his foot be elevated above the prominence of the bone?"
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	"And press him in a way that makes the bone return to its original position, and keep it there with some pressure."
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	"And then try to align the extremities of the fracture between them. If the extremity of the broken bone is thin and does not fit well with the instrument, you should insert the extremity of that bone into the tool so that it has enough power."
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	"But if you cannot reduce the bone with what has been recommended, then cut it using one of the instruments mentioned earlier, or saw it with one of the saws in whatever manner is possible for you."
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	"And also rasp that which remains on the bone from sharp edges and small chips."
E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.	"And when the bone has been reduced and during the reduction the patient feels intense pain on moving, know that the bone has not returned to its natural position. Therefore do this if you want to greatly benefit the patient."
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.	"When you have completed your treatment of the bone, then immerse it in black soap and water, especially if it is summer, and do not pour any grease or oil over it for fear that putrefaction and corruption may occur."
E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.	"And also apply splints at the time of completion of the bone treatment and leave the wound exposed until you insert them with forceps and use bandages according to the quantity of the wound."
E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.	"And be very careful that you do not strain the wound with the fracture, for many times fools have done this and caused harm to their patients with death or rotting flesh or other mischief. This is unhealthy."
E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.	"And if your traction is light, soft, different from the usual traction used for fractures."
E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.	"And if the wound is large or a bad wound and you fear that one of those unfortunate accidents may occur which have been mentioned earlier, and there is pain in the area, then it is not necessary to apply splints. Instead, make a dressing with hard cloths instead of splints and press it on."
E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.	"And when the wound begins to form scab about one or two days after applying the dressing, then remove it and apply poultices, which are used according to our custom for healing wounds, such as 'tetrafarmacum' and similar ones."
E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.	"And it is fitting for you to cleanse the wound and examine it every day morning and evening until it is consolidated and healed, and it is necessary that the member be prepared in such a way that putrefaction flows easily from it towards its openings."
si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.	"If many days have passed and the wound is not consolidated nor separated from the scab, then you should know that it is because of the small vessels. Therefore, explore the wound with a probe."
E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.	"And those vessels that are separated and removed or extracted should be left alone. Those that cannot be separated and cause pain in the member should be pursued and incised according to what you consider possible."
E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.	"If pus or ichor occurs in the wound, it is called 'stymia', or some other kind of corruption and putrefaction. Then you should apply one of those with which you consider appropriate for its cure, according to what has been described earlier in its chapter."
E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o xxx; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.	"And about this, in which it is fitting that I speak briefly and you weigh your patience: when the bone is crushed, do not presume to extract it or remove it because many times death has occurred for this reason. Leave it there until putrefaction occurs, for after twenty or thirty days it will fall out on its own. Then treat the wound if you see fit, and if not, leave it."
Capitol .xx.	"Chapter XX."
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	"Of the treatment of swelling that occurs at the site of any fracture."
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	"Very often this swelling occurs at the site of fracture healing, especially near joints, and it distorts the shape of the limb and hinders its natural operation."
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	"Therefore, if the swelling is recent, apply to it medicines that have astringent properties such as aloe, resin, myrrh, and similar ones. Take some or all of them and mix them with wine that has been thickened, or with albumen of egg, or with vinegar, and apply this mixture to the swelling on linen cloth, binding it tightly in place."
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	"And leave the dressing on for several days without removing it. Then remove it and apply another one until the swelling has disappeared. Or press a thin sheet of heated lead onto it, because lead has the property of reducing all swellings in the limbs."
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"But if the swelling has become hard and stiff and requires removal with caution, then incise it along its dominant seam and remove the excess or excise it with a rasp until it is removed. Then treat it until it is healed."
Capitol .xxi.	"Chapter XXI."
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	"Of the restoration of fracture when it has healed but the limb remains thin and weak, not following its natural course."
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	"When a fracture of the bone has healed, but the limb remains thin and weak, this occurs for many reasons: either because of too much solution of the liga
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	"The treatment for this is to give the patient good food to make his blood thicker, so that the blood is multiplied in him. And apply baths, and massage and laughter upon it."
E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.	"And also apply plaster onto the limb so that the plaster attracts much nourishment to it, or continue massaging it with warm water until the nourishment flows and returns to its natural shape."
Capitol .xxii.	"Chapter XXII."
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	"When broken bones are restored crookedly, forbid their operation."
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	"When a limb previously restored becomes crooked or prominent during the healing process due to a break and swelling of the bone, it may appear deformed but nonetheless the limb is not prohibited from its natural operation; therefore do not accept the opinion of anyone who considers that limb newly broken."
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	"However, many foolish doctors and restorers have done this in our land; and this operation is greatly to be condemned and causes great fear, the sign of which is deadly."
